ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
NOTES: The chief of staff of the FPRC and another fighter were killed in a MINUSCA airstrike on FPRC fighters as they advanced on Bambari. An FPRC spokesman said 3 civilians were killed and 5 others wounded, as well as houses destroyed during the airstrike. The attack took place just a few kms outside of Ippy at Ngawa 1. MINUSCA has declared attacking Bambari a 'red line' that should not be crossed.

ACTOR1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
ACTOR2: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa

As a result of the sustained pressure from the operations, Allied Democratic Forces elements continued to move north, including into Ituri province.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
ACTOR2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
NOTES: A attack against peacekeepers of the Indian contingent of the UN Mission Democratic Republic of Congo has killed a 7 year-old girl and wounded 32 peacekeepers and two civilians when explosion has been detonated remotely before 6:30 local time (4:30 GMT) Kyeshero, in Goma. The source added that the 'home-made' device went off while the militaries were exercising. The nature of the blast in unknown and, earlier, some source said the explosion of a grenade was pulled accidentally by a peacekeeper in training and two of them, along with a girl, died.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

NOTES: On 30 March 2020, MONUSCO elements carried out two aerial bombardments using attack helicopters against CODECO militiamen, flying over Mambisa and Ndo-Okebo, Banyali-Kilo and Walendu Djatsi (Ituri). The aim was to support FARDC efforts in the area against the militia. Neither injuries nor fatalities were reported.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

However, reports suggest that the air strikes led to ADF displacements from the centre to the south of the region, allowing the FARDC to identify them near the Beni-Kasindi axis.

NOTES: Ansar Dine fighters claimed a Grad rocket attack on a UN base in the Aguelhok area. No casualties were reported but a truck was destroyed. A second round of firing using mortars later in the day did no damage. After the first round of shelling, a Chadian patrol sent out to find the culprits hit an IED claimed by Ansar Dine. One peacekeeper was killed in the blast and at least 5 were seriously wounded; one later died of his injuries. Finally, an ambulance belonging to the Chadian MINUSMA contingent was hit by an IED as it went to pick up injured from the earlier IED. 8 people were injured during the events in total.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Around 8 mortar rounds were reportedly fired by AS forces at Villa Somalia in the afternoon of 15/03. 3 of the rounds landed in residential areas or in the compound of Radio Mogadishu killing 3 civilians and injuring 6 others. Several rounds landed in Villa Somalia without making any casualties. AMISOM/TFG forces reportedly responded by firing in the direction of Bakara market. Two of their rounds are said to have landed in the charcoal market and in Abdalla Shideeye area inside Bakara market. Medical sources indicate that this counter-fire led to the death of 8 civilians and the injury of 10 others.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 5 Mortar rounds were fired by AS towards Villa Baidoa. One mortar exploded in front of the gate to the Medina Hospital injuring 2 security guards. 3 other rounds landed inside the hospital but at least 2 of them failed to detonate. The 5th round hit police buildings adjacent to the hospital, killing 3 civilians and injuring 5 others. AMISOM responded to the attack by firing several rounds in the direction of Bakara Market. AMISOM mortars reportedly killed 2 civilians and injured 6 others.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM forces launched an attack against AS positions and managed to capture several key positions along Kidka Wadnaha Road as well as Bakara Market Junction in Hodan District. Reports indicate that Burundian troops occupied a two-storey building at the junction while TFG soldiers were positioned across the road. TFG/AMISOM forces also captured a police station, Osman Geedi Rage School and Aden Adde road junction in Howl-Wadag District. 3 mortar rounds reportedly fell on the vegetable and cereal sections of Bakara market, killing 4 and injuring 14. Total numbers of casualties for the day are not ascertained

ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 2 AS operatives armed with light weapons and explosive devices carried out a PBIED attack inside the MIA/AMISOM Protected Area of Mogadishu Seaport. The attackers entered the AMISOM protected area and detonated their explosive vest following a brief shootout with forces guarding the port. Conflicting reports about number of casualties starting from one civilian to 4 AMISOM soldiers are currently available. None of the reports could be fully verified. As opposed to the last PBIED attack conducted in Mogadishu the perpetrators of the recent attack were reported not to have been dressed in TFG uniforms.

NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy travelling on Aba-Gedo road on the south side of the Galbeed police station. Local residents reported that one of the AMISOM armored vehicles was damaged while one civilian was also reported killed and two others injured. AMISOM is believed not to have suffered any casualties.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces based in Mohamud Ahmed Ali School fired several mortar rounds towards Heliwa Market area in the evening of 02/10 after AS militias fired two rounds against the AMISOM base in Laf-Weyn Hotel. Information on casualties is unavailable.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: The AS and AMISOM forces exchanged mortar fire after the AS shelled a newly established AMISOM bases in Halima Hiti and Jamhuuriya neighborhood of Kaaraan district. Five civilians were reported killed and ten others injured in the exchange.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED explosion targeted an AMISOM convoy travelling between Trebuunka and the former Military Hospital. One civilian was reported killed and three others injured (all women). One of the AMISOM vehicles sustained minor damages. The AS movement claimed the responsibility of the attack. The TFG Police insisted that a PBIED was used to conduct the attack, an allegation that was contradicted by the AS.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Exchange of artillery fire was reported in Dayniile District in the evening of 24/10 after AS fired several mortar rounds against AMISOM/TFG positions in Bangala area. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED buried at the above mentioned area detonated in a close proximity to an AMISOM convoy. The explosion missed the convoy. One civilian was killed by the explosion.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM forces were reported to have conducted intense shelling of AS positions in Eel Arfid and Aliyale areas in Heliwa District. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED detonated in close proximity of an AMISOM convoy moving on Balcad Road between Fagax Road Junction and Laf-Weyn Hotel. The explosion injured two civilians. The AMISOM convoy is believed to have sustained no damage.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy detonated in Sii Sii neighborhood in Yaaqshiid District. The explosion killed two civilian bystanders but missed the military convoy.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy patrolling along Industrial Road near Radarka area. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Local medias report that an AMISOM convoy was hit by a RCIED on Washadaha Road in Shibis District. According to the same sources one soldier was killed and two others injured as a result of the attack, an assertion that is denied by local AMISOM commanders.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2004-2012)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM forces conducted intense shelling of the Wahara-adde neighbourhood. At least one mortar fired by AMISOM was reported to have exploded at Hidaaya Mosque killing two prominent religions scholars and injuring seven other (all members of the Tabliq group).

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS militias and TFG/AMISOM forces exchanged mortar fire in Gubta neighborhood and Gashandiga area (south of Dayniile District) in the night of 21/02. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED apparently targeting AMISOM troops exploded close to their base in Mohamoud Ahmed Ali School in the night of 10/03. Casualties could not be established. It was reported that the soldiers were unloading food when the incident happened. AS claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS militias coming from K13 fired several mortar rounds towards ex-Control Afgooye on 11/03. The mortars reportedly landed at an IDP camp in the former Medicine Factory. TFG/AMISOM forces responded by artillery/mortar fire directed at K13 and Kaax-Shiiqaal areas. Casualties in both areas couldn't be established.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Nasiib-Buundo area (Shibis) on 17/03. The device missed its target but a child was reportedly injured by the blast.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018)
NOTES: Al Shabaab agents bombarded the city of Baidoa with mortars targeting Baidoas international airport and state house. Ethiopian Somali and AMISOM troops fired a barrage of mortars back.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Gubta area (Dayniile) on 03/05. The AS celebrated the attack through Radio Andulus, claiming that at least five Ugandan soldiers had been killed.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS militants reportedly fired 10 rounds of mortars at AMISOM (Kenyan) and anti-AS positions in Faafax Dhuun Village (Baardheere District)

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Mowlaa Sheikh Ali Abdulle in Kaaraan District in the morning of 19/05. One of the AMISOM armored vehicle was damaged in the attack. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab responsibility for a roadside explosion targetting AMISOM.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM [African Unions Mission in Somalia] troops and those of Al-Shabab have exchanged mortars in the area between Afgooye and locality of Lanta Buuro

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2004-2012)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM forcesbased in LaantaBuuro shelled AS positions at Km 50 on 15/06.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An African Union (AMISOM) convoy hit a landmine in Mogadishus Huriwaa district on Friday evening, resulting in a massive explosion in the capital which killed at least four soldiers and wounded three others.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM soldiers based at the former cigarette factory on 03/07.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Ifka Halane neighbourhood (Wardhiigley)

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED explosion targeted an AMISOM convoy near Bar Ismail Junction in Afgooye on the evening of 23/07. The device missed its targeted.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A land mine or VOIED targeted AMISOM forces on patrol along Industrial Road in Hawl-Wadaag District in the evening of 19/08. AMISOM forces reportedly opened fire after the blast.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted TFG/AMISOM forces based in Salini village close to K50 (Afgooye District) in the morning of 21/08.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM forces took over control of Marka in the afternoon of 27/08 without any resistance. Reports indicate that AS fighters evacuated before the arrival of the allied forces, leaving behind a number of RCIEDs... TFG/AMISOM launched the offensive to capture the coastal town in the evening of 26/08.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: TFG/AMISOM forces took over control of Marka in the afternoon of 27/08 without any resistance. Reports indicate that AS fighters evacuated before the arrival of the allied forces, leaving behind a number of RCIEDs.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: AMISOM began bombarding Kismayo resulting in dozens of Al Shabaab deaths.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan warplanes have last evening mistakenly attacked a convoy of [Somali] government troops, with different accounts emerging of the casualties caused by the attacks.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: The Kenyan naval bombardment under the control of AMISOM continued for a second straight day. Col. Cyrus Oguna confirmed seven Al Shabaab fighters have been killed thus far from the shelling. Amongst those killed was a major Al Shabaab chief, Abdikadir Duecsane.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Kenyan naval ships under AMISOM fired missiles on Kismayo in assault on Al Shabaab stronghold.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan naval ships under AMISOM control firing missiles on Kismayo have led many local residents for fear of attacks resulting in heavy civilian casualties. No estimations yet of how many have relocated.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: The Kenyan naval bombardment under the control of AMISOM continued for a second straight day. Col. Cyrus Oguna confirmed seven Al Shabaab fighters have been killed thus far from the shelling. Amongst those killed was a major Al Shabaab chief, Abdikadir Duecsane.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: AMISOM and TFG warplanes continuously bombed the Al Shabaab defence lines in Biibi and Jana Cabdala even after claiming control over the city in previous days. Further reports by BBC monitoring on Sept. 6th confirmed how many fatalities in the bombings.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Reports from Lower Jubba Region state that many warplanes are launching the heaviest air strikes on Miido District, 25km from Afmadow town, second central administration base of Lower Jubba Region. Continuous bombardment has been ongoing for hours without a moment of reprieve.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Witnesses said a roadside bomb blast has tore through a military convoy carrying the African Union mission in Somalia (AMISOM) soldiers in Mogadishu on Thursday night.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Reports from Janaay Abdalla District on the outskirts of Kismaayo city, capital of Lower Jubba Region, say warplanes carried out attacks on the area.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Somali national army and their allied African Union forces, primarily Kenyan army attacked with mortars and machine guns on Al shabab controlled Birta-dheer village, Located on the outskirts of Kismayo, according to the reports.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Reports from Lower Jubba Region [southern Somalia] say Kenyan warplanes have heavily bombed areas in the region.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 200 hundred Al Shabaab agents surrendered to African Union and Somali government forces on Sunday amid a chain of bombings and assassinations in Mogadishu, Garowe Online reports.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al-Shabab has lost two key regional commanders in Saturday [29 September] morning raids by Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] airstrikes in Kismaayo, Somalia. The commanders, Shaykhs Hasan Yaqub and Abd-Karim Adow were killed a day after KDF, alongside Amisom [African Union Mission in Somalia] took control of Al-Shabab stronghold and headquarters of Kismaayo in Somalia.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Reports from Baardheere in Gedo Region [southwestern Somalia] say Kenyan warplanes have bombarded the town, causing deaths and injuries in the process.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Kenya (2002-2013)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Civilians (Somalia)
NOTES: Kenyan warships shell a southern port town recently controlled by al-Shabaab, who have by large number recently fled. The attack occurred either later September 30th or early October 1st. Casualties and injuries unknown. Following the assault Kenyan gunships patrolled the skies above the city and ground forces moved into the city. AL-Shabaab claims two children were killed in the attack, though this has not been substantiated. Many others injured. 100 suspected members of al-Sahbaab are arrested in the following hours and days.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A heavy blast, targeting entering AMISOM Kenyan forces, in claimed by al-Shebaab. Al-Shebaab further claims 'scores [are] dead and injured.' The event occurred after AMISOM offered amnesty to remaining Shebaab fighters.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: A 'number' of al-Shabaab fighters were either killed or arrested by AMISOM and government forces they attempted to plant landmines in the area outside Kismayo.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: A suicide bomber dressed in an army uniform detonated an explosive vest at a military checkpoint in Somalia but killed only himself. Officials believe the bomber was a member of al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Fleeing Shabaab fighters kill four AMISOM-Uganda soldiers with a large explosive as they advanced toward Baidoa town.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A roadside bomb targeting AMISOM forces explodes killing two and injuring others. Following the blast one of the AMISOM troops opened fire and wounded a civilian, though it is unclear if this was on purpose.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Raskamboni Brigade
NOTES: Al Shabab fighters launched night a mortar attack against ships docked the port of Kismayo city, where is largely controlled by Somali and Kenya forces along with the pro-government Raskamboni fighters.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Four AMISOM soldiers are killed when a suspected al Shabaab roadside blast detonated near a convoy.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted AMISOM soldiers as they passed through Bundo village in Marka district. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces found and disabled a remote controlled explosive planted on a bridge.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces launch rockets from the Arbiska area at a known al Shabaab hideout in Dharkenley. Residents in the area flee. Causalities unknown.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-); Women (Somalia)
NOTES: A hand-grenade was reportedly hurled at a residential house in Jaamacadaha area in the night of 09/12. Reports indicate that the house was the residence of a woman working as a translator for AMISOM. The woman survived but two female relatives were injured. The perpetrator(s) escaped unidentified. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Following the towns capture there was a series of twin mine blasts that caused no significant injury. AMISOM and government forces set up bases at the bridge and local administrative buildings in the town.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A Toyota Carib loaded with explosives exploded along the Maka-al-Mukarama road in the vicinity of Tre-Biano building and Ambassador Hotel in the afternoon of 14/12. The explosion occurred as an AMISOM convoy was passing in the area. Al Shabaab claimed later responsibility.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two consecutive RCIED attacks reportedly targeted a Somali/AMISOM convoy escorting the Governor of Lower Shabelle Region and some of his co-workers in Buufow Bacaad in the afternoon of 19/12 reported. Two vehicles in the convoy were reportedly damaged. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a AMISOM base in the Jaale Siyaad College within Hodan District. The soldiers were taking part in a New Year celebration at the time of the attack, but it is unclear if civilians were present. Causalities unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A landmine explosion targeting AMISOM soldiers injures three nearby civilians.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled three hand grenades at AMISOM (Burundian) soldiers on foot patrol in Bundo Bilan area in Haafad-Ruusiya neighbourhood of Marka town in the morning of 02/01. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeting a AMISOM convoy explodes in Biyo Degenka area (Yaaqshiid) in the evening of 09/01. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a contingent of AMISOM/Burundian soldiers on foot patrol at Bar Sports area in Marka in the evening of 11/01. Five people including two Burundian soldiers and three civilian bystanders were reportedly injured in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Militia (Anti-Al Shabaab)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired mortars at an anti-al Shabaab and KDF (AMISOM) forces position on the eastern outskirts of Afmadow in the evening of 19/01. The shelling was followed by a brief exchange of small arms fire before the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Six Shabaab fighters and four anti-al Shabaab soldiers were reportedly killed, while three al Shabaab fighters and three anti-AS soldiers were injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Militia (Anti-Al Shabaab)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired four rounds of mortar shells at anti-al Shabaab and AMISOM positions in Madhamato located in the outskirts of Kismaayo in the evening of 20/01. The mortar rounds missed their target. AMISOM responded with heavy artillery.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab soldiers attack a group of AMISOM (KDF) forces with an IED in a border town with Kenya. Causalities unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED planted by al Shabaab elements targeted a KDF (AMISOM) military vehicle in Kulbiyow village in Badhaadhe District in the afternoon of 20/01. Three KDF soldiers were reportedly killed and two others were wounded while the vehicle was partially damaged.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A IED targeted an AMISOM military convoy moving on Industrial Road close to a former Factory in Heliwa District in the afternoon of 24/01. The device missed its target and exploded between two vehicles in the convoy inflicting only minor damage.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED exploded at the livestock market near the AMISOM base in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood in Beled Weyne in the afternoon of 25/01. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched a mortar attack against a AMISOM/Ethiopian position near Baidoa airport. Several rounds landed in a nearby neighbourhood, destroying several houses. No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Aircraft of the Kenyan Air Force bombed Kala-Bayr village located between Garbahaarey and Baardheere towns in the afternoon of 31/01. The warplanes reportedly targeted al Shabaab bases in the village. Unconfirmed reports indicate that a al Shabaab commander was killed in the raid.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Militia (Anti-Al Shabaab)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds at KDF/anti-al Shabaab position in Balandhiible village (25kms SE of Afmadow). The allied forced did not respond to the attack. No casualty was reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A Burundi AMISOM solider is killed in a roadside style blast. Authorities blame al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeting AMISOM soldiers detonates in the Hodan District, killing one soldier.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: At least 14 civilians were injured after unidentified assailants hurled a grenade at a town hall in Baidoa. Witnesses believe the target of the attack were AMISOM soldiers in the area.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A IED targeted at an AMISOM military convoy missed its target in an area between Medina and Banaadir hospitals in Medina District in the morning of 07/02. Three civilian passersbys were reportedly wounded in the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM soldiers (Burundian contingent) based at ex-control Afgooye in Dharkeynley District in the morning of 10/02. The soldiers did not respond to attack. The attackers escaped from the scene. No report of injury or death.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A vehicle borne IED targeted a AMISOM military convoy, causing damage to the transport. Casualties not established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Two simultaneous IEDs targeting a AMISOM and Somali military convoy detonated near Kismaayo University in Farjano neighbourhood on 25/03. Two people were slightly injured in the explosion. No other casualties reported. Three people were arrested in connection with the two explosions.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A vehicle borne IED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Russia neighbourhood in Marka town in the morning of 01/04 but reportedly missed its target. There were no reports of casualties. AMISOM forces immediately launched a security operation but made no arrest.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A IED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Shaan village (32km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 02/04. Reports indicate that the explosion hit one of the vehicles in the convoy. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Somali and Djiboutian (AMISOM) soldiers near the police station in Beled Weyne in the morning of 16/04. Two people - a soldier and a civilian - were injured in the explosion. The soldiers conducted a security operation after the blast and arrested a young man they suspected of being behind the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A IED apparently targeted at an AMISOM water/fuel tank exploded near the Agriculture High School in Buula Jan neighbourhood, Marka, on 21/04. No reported causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A IED targeted at an AMISOM convoy travelling between Janaale and Buufow villages, Marka District, went off next to an APC that was part of the convoy on 21/04. An unspecified number of people on board were injured in the blast. AMISOM soldiers reportedly opened fire in all directions in response to the IED attack. Causalities unreported or unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab ambushed a KDF (AMISOM) convoy on the road between Hoosingo and Dhobley in Lower Juba on 23/04. Both sides used heavy and light weapons in the skirmish. Media reports suggested the KDF soldiers in the convoy called in air strikes to fend off the attack. An al Shabaab spokesman claimed 12 KDF soldiers were killed in the ambush, but this was quickly denied by the Kenyan military.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Militia (Anti-Al Shabaab)
NOTES: Unknown attackers hurled two hand grenades at a group of pro-government soldiers close to the police station in Beled Weyne in the evening of 23/04. One person was killed and several others were wounded. The motive for the attack remains unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape. A security operation was mounted after the attack and an unspecified number of suspects were arrested.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A group of AMISOM forces fell victim to a series of two bomb attacks as they were travelling along a road between Leego and Ballidoogle airfield. The first explosion did not cause any damage, though the second, which occurred five minutes after the first, damaged a vehicle in the convoy.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM (KDF) forces target Goob Weyn (14km NE of Kismayo) for an air strike against al Shabaab positions. Causalities unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM (Kenyan) air forces bombed Buulo Gaduud village (30km NE of Kismaayo) on the main road to Jilib in an attempt to destroy al Shabaab training camps in the area. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: The Somali Memo, a pro-al Shabaab source, reports a shelling to Burundi AMISOM forces in Ceelasha Biyaha, in Arbacoow locality. Causalities claimed, though vague and unsubstantiated.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Militia (Anti-Al Shabaab)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM/anti-al Shabaab (unidentified) forces in Bulo Gaduud village (30km NE of Kismaayo) on the main road to Jilib in the afternoon of 15/04. Casualties could not be established. Warplanes believed to be Kenyans bombed the v

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Militia (Anti-Al Shabaab)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against anti-al Shabaab/AMISOM (KDF) forces in Buusaar village (40kms E of Ceel Waaq) in the evening of 17/05. The two sides reportedly used both light and heavy weapons including mortars. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Militia (Anti-Al Shabaab)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against anti-al Shabaab/AMISOM (KDF) forces in Faxfaaxdhuun village in Baardheere District in the evening of 18/05. The allied forces responded with mortars and other artillery guns forcing the al Shabaab to retreat. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM police convoy passing near Damanyo settlement on the border between Hodan and Dayniile districts in the morning of 19/05. The convoy was reportedly on its way from Mogadishu Stadium back to airport when it came under the attack. A Casspir 'Mamba' was damaged in the attack. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted an AMISOM convoy in K60 area in rural Marka District in the evening of 26/05. No causalities reported, though a water bowser in the convoy was reportedly damaged in the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: An IED targeted an AMISOM/Somali forces convoy in Deg-Jenaay village approx. (14km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 27/05. There was believed to be a casualty resulting from the explosion but it is difficult to establish.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Bulo Joon neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 06/06. One Burundian soldier, a woman and a young girl around the age of three were injured in the explosion. The AMISOM forces reacted by firing in the suspected directions. The soldiers managed to arrest a suspect after a chase.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM forces on patrol near Hotel Baidoa (Baidoa) in the morning of 09/06. One civilian man was reportedly wounded in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted a AMISOM water browser near K60 area (Marka District) in the afternoon of 10/06. Casualties could not be established but the water browser was damaged by the blast. AMISOM forces sealed off the scene. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted Somali security forces at Bar Ismail in Afgooye in the morning of 17/06. An AMISOM military convoy was passing the area when the device went off. It remains unclear whether the RCIED was targeted at the Somali forces in the area or the AMISOM convoy. Two Somali soldiers were injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two Kenyan AMISOM troops are reported dead following an IED explosion against their convoy. A civilian vehicle was also hit during the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at an AMISOM convoy in the Saraha area of Marka in the morning of 18/06. The device missed its target and landed on the road side. A female bystander was injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED planted near a AMISOM water distribution facility is discovered by security forces and dismantled before it was allowed to detonate.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired five mortar rounds in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood in Beled Weyne in the evening of 25/06. Four of the rounds landed in an open air while the fifth one landed in a AMISOM compound. AMISOM forces did not respond to the attack. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched a mortar attack against Kenyan forces stationed at Kismayo airport. The Kenyan forces responded with heavy weapons. Losses sustained are unnumbered. The attacked was carried out during the evening hours.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted a AMISOM convoy at Xaaji Jamac Junction in Fanole neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 27/06. Following the blast the targeted soldiers began firing indiscriminately. Causalities could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted a AMISOM convoy at Maryan Khamiis area of Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 27/06. The convoy was rushing to Fanole neighbourhood where a second AMISOM convoy was targeted with an IED earlier. Causalities unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM sustained several causalities when their convoy was struck by a roadside bomb. Specific numbers not provided.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM patrol was targeted by a RCIED in proximity of Afar Irdood junction in the centre of Baidoa in the morning of 29/06. Two AMISOM soldiers and four civilians were reportedly injured (one civilian later succumbed to his injuries).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted AMISOM forces in Rushia neighbourhood in Marka in the afternoon of 30/06. Unconfirmed reports indicated that two AMISOM soldiers and civilian bystander were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted AMISOM forces convoy in an area between Awdheegle town and Bariire villages in Afgooye District in the morning of 02/07. Causalities could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired three mortar rounds at the Baidoa airport where AMISOM/ENDF are based in the night of 03/07. The ENDF responded with heavy artillery. There no were reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired a number of mortar rounds at AMISOM position near Kismaayo airport in the night of 06/07. AMISOM did not respond to the attack. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A IED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Coca-Cola factory in Yaaqshiid District in the evening of 10/07. The explosion damaged one of the AMISOM water bowsers. AMISOM forces blocked the road for about 30 minutes and later continued with their trip.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A IED targeted a AMISOM convoy near SOS Junction in Heliwa District in the morning of 11/07.Casualties or damages could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A suicide bomber detonated his explosives near a moving convoy of African Union troops killing himself and three civilian bystanders. Two soldiers wounded. The attack occurred near the airport.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A IED targeted an AMISOM convoy along the airport-K4 road (Haaji Dool area) in proximity of the WFP compound and several INGO offices in the afternoon of 12/07. Three AMISOM soldiers, six civilians were reportedly killed and eight others injured. The blast caused extensive damage to some properties along the road. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted AMISOM vehicles in Afgooye town in Bar Ismail area in the evening of 12/07. Reports indicate that the explosion damaged a water tanker. AMISOM closed the area after the explosion. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene unidentified.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Sierra Leone (2007-2018)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds at Sierra Leonean forces based in Kismaayo in the night of 15/07. The Sierra Leonean forces responded with artillery and small arms fire, forcing al Shabaab withdraw. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A IED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing near Maslah base in the livestock market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 16/07. An AMISOM water bowser was reportedly damaged in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Five soldiers and two civilians are wounded, and several other injured after am IED targeting AMISOM forces detonates. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility immediately following the bombing.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds at Aawdiinle Village in Baidoa District in the night of 18 17/07. AMISOM forces responded by firing artillery guns in the direction of the al Shabaab attackers. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A IED targeted an AMISOM convoy travelling along the Mogadishu-Afgooye road near Siinka-Dheer in the evening of 19/07. Causalities could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Sierra Leone (2007-2018)
NOTES: A land mine targets AMISOM/Sierra Leone forces near Kismayo hospital. Witnesses claim four civilian deaths. The number of military deaths is unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unconfirmed reports indicate that Kenyan warships patrolling Somali coast off Kismaayo shelled Goob Weyn village (13km N of Kismaayo) in the early morning of 22/07. At least two civilians were reportedly severely wounded. Goob Weyne is a base of forces loyal to Barre Hiraale.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the afternoon of 24/07. An AMISOM truck was reportedly damaged in the explosion. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED attack targeted an AMISOM convoy on the Afgooye - Marka road in Ceel-wareegow on 27/07. The explosion reportedly damaged a water tanker. No other casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired several mortars at Somali/AMISOM base at the former perfume factory in Heliwa District in the early morning of 27/07. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED attack targeted an AMISOM (Burundian) convoy in Buulojaan neighbourhood of Merka town in the morning of 28/07. After the explosion al Shabaab attacked forces the convoy with small arms and RPGs. At least one AMISOM soldier was injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy moving between Afgooye and Bariire (11km NE of Aw Dheegle) in the afternoon of 03/08. The explosion damaged one of the AMISOM vehicles. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Eight mortar rounds presumably aiming AMISOM/Somali positions fell in the area of the Mogadishu Stadium in the night of 04/08. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted a AMISOM convoy close to Xarunta Gabdha (Girls Orphanage College) in Afgooye in the morning of 11/08. One of the trucks was damaged. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM forces based in Jaale Siyaad military academy (Hodan district) in the evening of 13/08. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab elements planted five IEDs on the main road in Marka on 14/08. They then detonated one of them which prompted Somali/AMISOM forces to arrive at the scene. The suspected al Shabaab elements then detonated the remaining four. The perpetrators use of small charges in the IEDs saved the lives of the Somali/AMISOM who rushed to the scene after the first explosion. A number of civilian bystanders were injured in the first explosion. No other casualties were reported in the subsequent explosions.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted an AMISOM military convoy at Bar Jowhar area in Heliwa District in the evening of 16/08. One AMISOM truck was reportedly destroyed in the explosion. The perpetrators escaped. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED exploded at Laami-yaraha road in Afgooye in the afternoon of 24/08 after a private lorry drove over it. Four people in the truck were injured in the blast. Reports indicate that the road is frequented by AMISOM military convoy and it is believed that AMISOM had been the target. Further reports indicate that AMISOM forces disabled two other RCIEDs planted on the same road after a tip off from the public.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Militia (Anti-Al Shabaab)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against KDF/anti-al Shabaab (not named) forces in Faafax Dhuun Village in the evening of 28/08. Al Shabaab reportedly used mortars during the attack. The two sides exchanged fire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An explosion occurred on Macalin Nuur Street, near Mogadishu University building housing Burundian troops in a series of coordinated attacks throughout the city.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An attack targeting federal government and Amisom [African Union Mission in Somalia] troops in Mogadishu caused 10 casualties. The attack, a heavy explosion, occurred near Arafat Hospital at noon.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED, planted at the water point in Billis Qooqaani (48km SW of Afmadow) exploded in the morning after KDF/AMISOM forces reached the area to draw water. One KDF soldier sustained minor injuries while. The blast also destroyed a KDF vehicle.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military truck in Ceel Jaale Village (7km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 24/09. The explosion hit the rear side of the truck and reportedly caused a big damage. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab operatives launched hit and run attacks against Somali/AMISOM forces based in Abdi Wayeel area and the former perfume factory (Heliwa District) in the evening of 28/09. Reports indicate that the attackers also fired mortars at the bases of the allied forces, who also responded with artillery guns. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at AMISOM base near the livestock market in Hawl-Wadaag District (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 29/09. No causalities were reported. The attackers escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Ex-control Balcad neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 30/09. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The attackers managed to escape.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Bulo-Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 02/10. The convoy was escorting a water bowser by the time of the attack. Reports indicate that the device missed its target. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted a military pick-up patrolling the road between Shalaambood and Buufow Bacaad villages (Marka District) in the afternoon of 02/09. A number of soldiers were killed and others injured. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A landmine blast targets AMISOM soldiers at Makundi locality in Baidoa town. Somali government soldiers responded to the attack and made several arrests. Causalities list not reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy in Bariire Village (27km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 05/10. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted a AMISOM/KDF APC in Balacaad neighbourhood in Kismaayo in the morning of 10/10. No casualties were reported but the APC was damaged. Jubaland forces arrested a woman they suspected of being behind the attack. Unconfirmed reports indicate the perpetrators were waiting in a minibus, close to the scene and detonated the device after the APC slowed at the scene. The minibus then drove away.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Ethiopia (1991-2018)
NOTES: At 12:00 on 19/10 a suicide bomber on foot (PBIED) attacked a tea-shop in the centre of Beled Weyne town in front of the Hiraan regional administration office. The attack was followed by heavy gunfire. The shop is heavily frequented by AMISOM/Djiboutian and Ethiopian troops and is believed to be the target of the blast. Initial and UNCONFIRMED information received from local medical sources indicate that up to 50 persons may have been killed. Later this number was reduced to 30. 85 others are reported to have been referred to the Beled Weyne regional hospital for treatment of various injuries.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy passing through the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 26/10. An AMISOM water bowser was badly damaged by the explosion. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy and destroyed a water tanker in Ruusiya neighbourhood in Marka on 01/11/2013. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Casualties could not be established. The attackers escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a mortar attack against Janaale village in Marka district in the evening of 02/11/2013. AMISOM/Somali government forces opened fire after the shelling. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 06/11. Reports indicate that the device hit one of the AMISOM vehicles. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Reports indicate that Kenya military helicopters carried out an airstrike against an al Shabaab position in the vicinity of Koday village on 12/11. Two al Shabaab vehicles were reportedly destroyed. At the same time Raas Kambooni forces carried out a KDF-coordinated military operation in the outskirts of the village. Reports indicate that three Raas Kaambooni soldiers were injured and one killed. Unconfirmed reports indicate that around 12 al Shabaab militiamen were killed in the operation.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED reportedly planted on the roadside targeted AMISOM forces in Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the afternoon of 17//11. Two AMISOM soldiers were injured and an AMISOM truck was damaged in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted AMISOM convoy in Gasala (8km E of Baidoa) in the morning of 18/11. Reports indicate that the blast followed a hit-and-run attack conducted by al Shabaab fighters. An AMISOM truck was slightly damaged in the explosion. Unconfirmed reports indicate that al Shabaab suffered heavy casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy on the road between Ceymiska and ex-Control Balcad (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 18/11. Reports indicate that the device missed the target. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military truck in Xawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye District) in the afternoon of 20/11. AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. One AMISOM soldier was reportedly killed in the explosion and the truck was damaged. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: At least 21 camels are killed in a bomb blast intended for AMISOM forces. Conflicting report: local herders claim AMISOM forces intentionally killed the camels.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab forces launched a series of attacks on a AMISOM base located in Lafoole during the late evening hours. AMISOM forces responded with mortar fire. Combatant injuries not known. Two civilians injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM forces passing in Hawindha Village (94km E of Afmadow) in the morning of 25/11. One AMISOM truck was damaged in the blast. The explosion was followed by heavy exchange of assorted firearms that could be heard in Dhoobley town. The convoy had left Tabta and was heading to Dhoobley when the ambush took place. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeted an AMISOM water bowser in Aawdiinle Village in Baidoa District in the morning of 03/12. No casualties or damages were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Pro-al Shabaab media reported that al Shabaab fighters carried out a mortar attack against AMISOM and government forces based at Maslax camp (Heliwa District) on 03/12. The report stated that the al Shabaab fighters fired about 4-5 mortar rounds at the camp but AMISOM forces did not respond. The attack occurred in the early morning hours.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Administration
NOTES: A RCIED exploded in the area between Gulwade and Fanoole neighbourhoods (Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 05/12. The device reportedly missed its target, which was an AMISOM convoy carrying the president of Jubaland towards the state house in Kismaayo. The president reportedly returned from the airport after meeting with an IGAD delegation.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters in Banaadir governorate launched a missile attack on the AMISOM base at Stadium Mogadishu. No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM water bowser in Shalaambood Village (10km W of Marka) in the afternoon of 10/12. The water bowser was transporting water from Ceel-Jaale (8km NW of Marka) when the incident happened. AMISOM forces conducted a security operation in the area immediately after the blast and arrested an unspecified number of people. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired five mortar rounds towards Shatiguduud airport in Baidoa in the night of 12/12. The mortar rounds landed inside AMISOM compound. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy near Jaale Siyad Military Academy (Hodan District) in the evening of 21/12. The convoy was heading to AMISOM base located in the military academy when the incident happened. Casualties could not be established. An unspecified number of AMISOM vehicles were damaged in the explosion.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy along the industrial road at ex-Control Balcad (Heliwa District) in the morning of 27/12. No casualties were reported but one AMISOM vehicle was slightly damaged.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeting an AMISOM military convoy in Marka on 27/12. Unconfirmed reports indicate that four Burundian soldiers were killed in the blast and a number of others were injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM military convoy at Dalcada in Calanley neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 29/12. Casualties could not be established since AMISOM forces sealed off the area after the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A landmine targeted an anti-mine vehicle of Kenyan AMISOM forces in the Afmadow neighbourhood of Kismayo. Causalities reported, though specific numbers were not provided.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: KDF-AMISOM airplanes conducted air strike against an al Shabaab position in Birt Dheer (11km SE of Garbahareey) in the afternoon of 09/01. Initial reports indicate that ten persons were killed and unspecified numbers of people were injured and taken to Bardheere for treatment. This number was raised to 57 in the following weeks. Further reports suggest that a car was destroyed and al Shabaab fighters fled to Buur-dhuubo (36km SE of Garbahareey). Among the dead include six foreign al Shabaab leaders.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing between Lafoole and Carbiska (Afgooye District) in the afternoon of 12/01. Reports indicate that one AMISOM soldier was injured, two civilians bystanders were reportedly killed and four others were injured in the blast. The convoy was heading to Afgooye when the indecent happened. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds at KDF base at the northern side of Kismaayo in the night of 12/01. AMISOM forces conducted security operation early in the morning along the main road up to Goob weyne area. No arrests were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing at Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 16/01. Reports indicate that the attack was carried out by al Shabaab operatives. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A pro-al Shabaab FM radio Facebook page published a report indicating that al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds at AMISOM based Mogadishu football stadium building (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 19/01. No casualties were reported. Details and reliability of the report could not be independently verified.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired mortars towards Kismaayo town in the evening of 22/01. Three of the mortars landed near the State House. AMISOM (KDF) responded by firing back in the suspected direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy passing between Baidoa and Goof-Gaduud in Dhanqoob area in the afternoon of 25/01. Reports indicate that the ambush was initiated by a RCIED blast. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing in Biyo Deegaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the morning of 27/01. Reports indicate that the device missed its target which was a water tanker. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing on Industrial Road through Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 27/01. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing inside Wanla Weyne town in the afternoon of 28/01. Reports indicate that the device went off after the convoy had passed it. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds against AMISOM/KDF forces based in Kismaayo Airport in the evening of 29/1. Reports indicate that KDF fired back in response to the attack. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Reports from Ceel-Wareegow indicate that mortar rounds have been fired at between Ceel-Wareegow (11km NE of Marka) and the coastal area on 04/02. It is believed that Somali/AMISOM forces fired the mortars after suspecting that al Shabaab have bases at the targeted areas.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Lafoole neighbourhood (6km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 11/02. The explosion missed the target and exploded just after the convoy had passed the spot. A civilian bystander was killed in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Baar Ismail neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 12/02 with a RCIED attack. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. Casualties could not be established. The convoy was heading to Mogadishu when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds against AMISOM positions in Baidoa airport in the night of 13/02. Two rounds landed in the airport and four others in open areas. No damage or casualties were reported. The rounds were reportedly fired from a position NW of the airport.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in K13 area along the Mogadishu-Afgooye road in the morning of 14/02. An AMISOM APC was badly damaged. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab forces report they have shelled AMISOM-Kenya positions at Kismayo airport. Causalities not known. The attack was not confirmed by AMISOM forces as of 17/02.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Ceelasha Biyaha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 22/02. AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. One the vehicles hit the device. Casualties and damages could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces in Balli Doogle come under mortar fire during the nighttime hours. Causalities not reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 26/02. One AMISOM soldier was injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Buufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 01/03. AMISOM soldiers cordoned off the scene after the blast. Reports indicate that the convoy had left Marka and was heading to K-60 when the incident happened. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy at ex-control Balcad area (Heliwa District) in the morning of 02/03. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near K60 Village (27km NE of Marka) in the morning of 03/03. AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. Casualties could not be established. One AMISOM vehicle was damaged by the blast. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM/Ethiopia convoy in Miidoow (between Baidoa and Awdiinle on the road to Luuq/Doolow) on 07/03. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds at AMISOM and Somali forces based in Buur Dhuxunle in the late night of 08/03. The allied forces fired back. Casualties are unknown. AMISOM/Somali forces entered the village earlier in the day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM-Kenya forces shell an al Shabaab base in Saraako, 55 kilometres from Baardheere with at least 10 missiles. There are no independent reports that can verify casualties caused by that attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against an AMISOM position in the former perfume factory (Heliwa District) in the night of 12/03. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan AMISOM aircraft bomb an al Shabaab camp in Bardera, killing 32.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM military vehicle in Shalaambood Village (10km W of Marka) in the afternoon of 15/03. The device was reportedly planted by al Shabaab operatives. The vehicle was reportedly damaged by the blast. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces fired several mortar rounds at Farxaane Village (4km SW of Qoryooley) in the night of 23/03 following reports that al Shabaab fighters were regrouping in the village to attack against AMISOM/Somali forces in Qoryooley. Unconfirmed reports indicate that 13 al Shabaab fighters were killed by mortar rounds. A vehicle belonging to al Shabaab was also destroyed in the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Kali-Caafimaad Village (20km NE of Marka) located between Afgooye-Marka towns in the afternoon of 25/03. One AMISOM vehicles was damaged by the explosion. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Bar Ismail area in Afgooye in the afternoon of 26/03. AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. At least one civilian was killed and six others injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A civilian was reportedly killed and three others injured following a landmine explosion targeting AU Mission in Somalia [AMISOM] forces at Dalcada neighbourhood in Kismaayo. Eyewitnesses told the local media that the casualties were caused by the ensuing exchange of fire between militants and AMISOM troops after the explosion.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds against Somali government/AMISOM positions in Garbahaarey town in the evening of 29/03. The allied forces fired back with mortars towards the estimated position of the al Shabaab militias. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Maslah compound on the main road to Balcad (Heliwa District) in the evening of 29/03. AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the morning of 30/03. Casualties are unknown. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Danow village (16km W of Marka) in the morning of 02/04. The convoy stopped and closed the road immediately after the incident. An AMISOM truck was reportedly severely damaged by the blast. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab forcers detonate an explosive device near a convoy of soldiers as they travelled between Daanow and Kabran Las located outside recently sized Qoryooley District. An AMISOM soldier who spoke on condition of anonymity said that they suffered 'deaths and injuries,' though numbers were not provided.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Government of Jubaland (2013-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers fired mortar rounds at the state house in Kismaayo in the night of 14/04. Two mortar rounds landed near the state house. AMISOM/Jubaland forces fired in the direction of the attackers. AMISOM/Jubaland forces fired in the direction of the attackers. A senior official of the Jubba administration was reported killed in the blast.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers fired mortar rounds at the state house in Kismaayo in the night of 14/04. Two mortar rounds landed near the state house. AMISOM/Jubaland forces fired in the direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported. AMISOM/Jubaland forces fired in the direction of the attackers. A senior official of the Jubba administration was reported killed in the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Goob Weyn Village (14km NE of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 19/04. AMISOM forces were escorting a group of elders and MPs tasked to mediate between Bare Hiraale group and the SNG. The incident happened at a time when the convoy was returning to Kismaayo. The mediation team was appointed by the prime minister recently. No casualties were reported. One AMISOM vehicle was reportedly damaged.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM water tanker in Shalaambood Village (Marka District) in the morning of 21/04. AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. The driver of the tanker was injured. The vehicle was also damaged.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED reportedly aimed at an AMISOM convoy detonated prematurely in Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka District) in the evening of 25/04. AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. A shop caught fire after it was hit by a RPG fired by the AMISOM forces.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM helicopters bombed al Shabaab fighters regrouping in a farm near Mashalaay Village (9km SE of Qoryooley) in the morning of 28/04. About three al Shabaab fighters are believed to have been killed and more than 17 others wounded in the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attacks a joint AMISOM-Somali location in Faafax Dhuun. Witnesses described that the shelling brought severe fatalities including death and casualties, though no numbers were provided. Reports indicate heavy weapons were used.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
NOTES: Unidentified attackers fired mortar or B10 rounds at Silliga, Jiro Miskin and Badbado IDP settlement (Wadajir District) in the night of 01/05. One round reportedly landed in a residential house near Silliga, killing one person and injuring three others. Four civilians were injured in Jiro Miskin neighbourhood. The target of this attack is believed to have been the AMISOM/Burundian detachment base in the former National University in Dharkeynley District.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM/Somali convoy passing near Ceel-Cadde (51km SW of Garbahareey) in the afternoon of 05/05. Reports indicate that the convoy was destined to cell-Cadde when the incident happened. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted an AMISOM military convoy on the road towards Goof-Gaduud near Baidoa in the morning of 06/05. One AMISOM soldier was injured. An AMISOM vehicle was damaged by the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing at Haafad Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 14/05. Reports indicate that the AMISOM forces opened fire indiscriminately in response to the blast. Casualties are unknown. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers fired three mortar or B10 rounds in Dharkenley District in the night of 14/05. Reports indicate that the rounds landed at Siliga Amerikaanka, Badbaado IDP settlement and Nur Aduunyo neighbourhood. It seems that the mortar was targeting the AMISOM/Burundian contingent based at the former National University and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs building. One round landed on a residential area close to Badbaado IDP settlement and injured two people.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan-AMISOM air forces launch a bombing run on an al Shabaab base in Manayagabo, 2km east of Jilib. Witnesses said bombs had landed on the main route out of the town and along a road that least to Kismayo. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: On 20 May 2014, AMISOM-Kenya forces launched an airstrike for the second time in three days on the Jilib area, a al Shabaab stronghold. Initially, four civilians reported sustaining injuries from the shelling. AMISOM claimed to have killed 50 members of al Shabaab in the strike. Conflicting reports claimed that civilians died in the attack. Al Shabaab did not release causality figures. The airstrike caused mass displacement of the local population in the following days.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM/SNG forces based in Janaale (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 23/05. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: At least one person was killed and two others have been injured in an aerial bombardment on the outskirts of Jilib. AMSISOM forces have struck bases outside of Jilib earlier in the week.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two KDF war planes conducted an air strike against al Shabaab controlled Jilib town on 24/5. Reports indicate that the plane had hit three different locations in the town. Two children and a woman were killed after the air strike hit a residential house. Details of injured civilians could not be established. Reports from Jilib town indicate that local residents started evacuating the town on 25/05 following series of bombardments by Kenya air forces which reportedly led to the killing and injuring of civilian populations. The IDPs were reportedly fleeing to Kismaayo and other villages. Reports suggest that al Shabaab fighters have denied their movement and even some civilians were reportedly force to return to Jilib town.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing by Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the morning of 26/05. Reports indicate that the device hit at the back side of one of the vehicles. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces reportedly shelled Bandar Village (4km SW of Qoryooley) in the afternoon of 29/05 following reports that al Shabaab fighters had been hiding in the village. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Janaale (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 08/06. Reports indicate that the soldiers reportedly opened fire in response to the blast. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
