NOTES: A RCIED or a land mine targeted an AMISOM/Djibouti contingents vehicle near the new airstrip in Bulo Burte town in the morning of 11/06. Three soldiers were injured in the blast. AMISOM/SNG forces conducted a security operation after the blast and arrested several suspects.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/Somali government forces convoy near Ceel Waaq in the morning of 17/06. The ambush started with a detonation of a RCIED followed by direct confrontation between the two sides. The convoy had left Ceel Waaq and was heading to Ceel-Cadde (50km SW of Garbahaarey) when the incident happened. Three al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed. AMISOM/SNG casualties could be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab ambush AMISOM convoy near Ceel Cadde (50km SW of Garbahharey) on 17/06. The ambush started with a RCIED attack against AMISOM convoy.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan-AMISOM air forces launch strikes against two al Shabaab held areas - Anole and Kuday. Thirty killed in Anole, 50 in Kuday, according to the AU.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan-AMISOM air forces launch strikes against two al Shabaab held areas - Anole and Koday. Thirty killed in Anole, 50 in Kuday, according to the AU.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing in the vicinity of Baar Jowhar (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 21/06. Reports indicate that a civilian woman bystander was killed. Casualties from AMISOM side could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: The KDF war-planes conducted an airstrike targeting al Shabaab fighters in Jadecaley village (19km NW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 24/6. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeted against an AMISOM (Kenyan contingent) convoy near Buusaar Village (38km SE of Ceel Waaq) in the afternoon of 28/06. The device is believed to have been planted and detonated by al Shabaab fighters. The convoy had left Ceel Waaq and was heading to Buusaar Village when the explosion happened. Unconfirmed reports indicate that an AMISOM soldier was killed and a truck damaged in the explosion.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM Caspir vehicle travelling in a convoy hit a RCIED in an area between SOS and Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 30/06. The vehicle was completely destroyed by the blast. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters had fired several mortar rounds against AMISOM/SNG positions in Qoryooley in the afternoon of 02/07. Reports indicate that the allied forces responded by firing mortar rounds in the directions of the attack. A civilian was killed and six others were injured in the shelling. Casualties from the two warring sides could not be established.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A VBIED targeted the Somalia Parliament gate facing Sayidka Junction of (Hawl-Wadaag and Wardhiigley Districts) in the morning of 05/07. Reports indicate that the VBIED (Toyota NOAH) driven by a suicide bomber was targeting the parliament and when the security guards, including AMISOM, stopped at the gate to be checked prompting the explosion. Meanwhile the parliament was in a session when the attack took place and the MPs were been evacuated safely. Five people -two of them children from Sayidka IDPs - were killed. Al Shabaab claimed the attack, claiming 32 deaths.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM/KDF launched airstrikes against al Shabaab positions in Buscbusc Village (30km SE of Badhaadhe) on the midday of 09/07. The village is reportedly strategic for al Shabaab fighters due to its thick forest and boreholes. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces conducted a military operation in depth at Al-Shabaab camp in Busc Busc located 115 kilometres south west of Kismayo town. The camp was used as a hide out for Al-Shabaab to conduct Improvised Explosive Devices (IED) and ambush attacks against sector 2 forces. During this operation, an important number of Al-Shabaab fighters were killed (numbers not reported), several wounded, and their vehicles and other equipment were destroyed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired six mortar rounds apparently targeting AMISOM/SNG positions in Baidoa town in the afternoon of 12/07/2014. The mortars are believed to have been fired from Aboo Asharow cemetery some 3-5km south of Baidoa. Four rounds landed near Hassey Factory in Berdaale neighbourhood while the other two landed in an area between ADC and Shatigaduud airport. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Reports say that two Kenyan planes bombarded Faafaxdhuun [Fafahdun] and Ceel Cadde [El Adde] districts in Gedo Region. The attack killed three civilians and wounded many others. The attacks occurred during the evening hours. The intended targets of the attacks are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Reports say that two Kenyan planes bombarded Faafaxdhuun [Fafahdun] and Ceel Cadde [El Adde] districts in Gedo Region. The attack killed three civilians and wounded many others. The attacks occurred during the evening hours. The intended targets of the attacks are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan warplanes bombed Jilib town which is under the control of al Shabaab fighters on 16/7. The warplanes reportedly targeted two positions in the town. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired a mortar round against AMISOM base in Bulo Burto in the night of 21/07. Reports indicate that the AMISOM forces fired back. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan warplanes bombed Jilib town which is under the control of al Shabaab in the night of 22/07. The raid was reportedly targeting an al Shabaab training camp but the missiles hit in an empty area. One civilian was injured in the attack. This attack is apparently different and separate from an attack in Jilib at another time during the day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Eight people including four children were injured after Kenyan warplanes bombarded southern Somali town of Jilib. The warplanes hit Asho Neera locality which Al-Shabab has a base. Al Shabaab returned fire at the planes.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers targeted AMISOM convoy with an RCIED in Marka town in the evening of 23/07/2014. The explosion inflicted unknown casualties on the AMISOM convoy. Shortly after the explosion AMISOM forces started firing Mortar rounds at some neighbourhoods of Marka town, namely Ruusiya and Saraha, apparently killing 4 civilians and injuring more others. The perpetrators managed to escape from the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan AMISOM gain control of Khadijo Haji after a series of airstrikes earlier in the day which caused al Shabaab to flee their positions.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Kenyan warplanes bombed Khadijo Haji (39km SW of Beled Xawo) in the night of 24/07. No casualties were reported. It is believed that the airstrike was in reaction to the reports of al Shabaab movement near Beled Xawo.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Raskamboni Brigade
NOTES: Raskamboni forces attack al Shabaab locations along the outskirts of Kismayo. AMISOM-Kenyan air forces also took part in the attack, presumably providing air cover. At least 20 dead and 30 injured. The assault is likely a reaction to an attack on a Raskamboni commander the previous evening.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy hit a RCIED planted on the roadside in Rusiya neighbourhood in Marka in the afternoon of 09/08. The AMISOM soldiers opened fire after the blast. The soldiers also beat a woman bystander and reportedly looted food stuff from some shops in the area. There were no reports of AMISOM casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Rusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 15/08. One AMISOM vehicle was damaged but no human casualties reported. This is the second RCIED attack against AMISOM forces in the same neighbourhood in a week.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Militia (Pro-Government)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds at two different occasions in Xudur in the night of 17/08. AMISOM/pro-SNG forces did not respond to the attack since the rounds landed in an area far from their positions. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM troops convoy was targeted with an RCIED in Ceel Jaale on the 20/08 by unknown attackers. AMISOM forces cordoned off the area and search of the perpetrator. No casualties and no arrests were reported. The convoy continued the trip to its destination.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing on Fagax Junction near Kaah Hotel (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 21/08. A civilian bystander was injured in the blast. AMISOM casualties could not be established. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A pro-al Shabaab website published a report that al Shabaab fighters targeted AMISOM convoy with a RCIED on the road between Yaaq Biri Weyne (Wanla Weyne District), and Leego (Buur Hakaba District) on 22/08. The website stated that a water tanker was damaged in the explosion but did not report any human casualty.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Militia (Pro-Government)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds at Waajid in the night of 23/08. Two of the rounds exploded in an empty area while the other two failed to explode. AMISOM/pro-SNG forces did not respond to the attack.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Witnesses claim a SNG/AMISOM shelling of Bulo Mareer, a al Shabaab held town, on the evening of 29/08. Causalities not known. The following day military and government officials declared a new offensive in the region, with an aim of recapturing al Shabaab held areas.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar shells against AMISOM forces based at Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) after mid-night of 01/09. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar shells against AMISOM positions in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) in the night of 03/09. Reports indicate that AMISOM forces reacted with anti-aircraft missiles and mortars. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED/Landmine targeted AMISOM convoy near Gol-Weyn village (21km SW of Marka) in the morning of 06/09. The device which was reportedly a landmine was planted on the road side and exploded before the AMISOM convoy reached the place. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Government of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A VBIED targeted AMISOM convoy near Xawo-Cabdi settlement (9km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 08/09. Reports indicate that a Toyota NOAH laden with explosives driven by a self-suicide detonated in to the AMISOM convoy. The convoy was coming from Lower Shabelle Region and heading to Mogadishu when the incident happened. Further reports indicate that two civilian mini-buses who were using the road behind the convoy had also involved the incident. The governor of Lower Shabelle, who survived from the attack, confirmed that; two international military advisers - an American and South African - and two AMISOM soldiers were among the injured. At least 16 civilians were killed while about 27 others were injured. Al Shabaab spokesman, Sheikh Abdul-Aziz Abu Musab stated that they carried out the attack targeting American officials who were travelling with the convoy and was aimed to avenge for the killing of their leader (GODANE). A Pentagon spokeswoman when contacted said that; there were no US personnel hurt in the attack but not commented whether American officials were with the convoy. Despite the claims of the State Department, following the attack al Shabaab claimed they have 'killed an American General.' On the same note, an executive Director for an American company providing mentorship services for AMISOM said that their employees had involved the attack, but said none of them was injured and neither is an American.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 14/09. Reports indicate that the AMISOM forces opened fire in response to the blast. The convoy was coming back from Kurtunwaarey when the incident happened. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy inside Buulo Mareer town (29km SW of Marka) in the morning of 15/09. Reports indicate that the blast reportedly damaged an AMISOM Casper carrier. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab forces shell Kismayo airport (which houses a AMISOM base) for two consecutive nights. Causalities not known or not reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab forces shell Kismayo airport (which houses a AMISOM base) for two consecutive nights. Causalities not known or not reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: At least five civilians are killed after a road-side blast targeting AMISOM-Burundi forces in the Dalcadda area of Calanley neighbourhood.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Via Afmadow Market in Shaqaalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 20/09. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. Jubaland forces arrived and checked the area for other RCIEDs.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab targets AMISOM soldiers with a roadside blast in Marka, destroying their vechicle. No word of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy near Gol-Weyn (21km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 01/10. The convoy was heading to Buulo Mareer when the incident happened. One AMISOM carrier was damaged by the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Goobweyne (14km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 06/10. A KDF armoured vehicle was damaged in the explosion. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: War planes belong to Kenyan forces conducted air strike against al Shabaab locations in Jilib town in the morning of 07/10. Reports indicate that some local residents fled to Kismaayo or other safer places following the air strike. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM troops stationed in Danow opened fire against a vehicle carrying a group SNG soldiers near Danow (Marka District) in the afternoon of 09/10 after they were informed that the vehicle was carrying explosives. The soldiers were reportedly transporting Khat to Buulo Mareer town when the incident happened. One SNAF soldier was killed and another one got injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces fired artillery shells against al Shabaab positions in Kurta. Some shells were also launched in the Weeley area. No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of SOS Junction (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 19/10. Casualties are unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy passing near Beerta Liinta in the vicinity of Mooda-Mooda village (25km SE of Baidoa) in the morning of 21/10. The device reportedly hit a fuel tanker burning it completely. Local farmers in the area run away immediately from the incident scene but AMISOM forces chased them and managed to arrest one of the farmers. Its currently unclear if the farmers had connection with attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy comes under grenade attack in Markas Ruusiya and Bayturaas neighbourhoods. Following the attacks angered AMISOM forces committed atrocities against civilians in the town, including killing three elders.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Jubaland forces back up by KDF in logistics and aerial support take-over Abdale Birole village (43km SW of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 24/10. Al Shabaab fighters had left the village prior to the arrival of Jubaland forces. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: RCIED targeted AMISOM troops on foot patrol in Sheekh Abroone neighbourhood in Marka in the morning of 30/10. The soldiers started shelling Ruusiya and Sheekh Abroone neighbourhoods after the blast. Two civilians were killed and more than eight others injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Three RCIEDs were targeted at AMISOM military convoy in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the morning of 02/11. Unspecific numbers of AMISOM vehicles were damaged in the explosion. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing near Rage-Ceele (45km NE of Warsheikh) in the morning of 11/11. The device reportedly hit and damaged one of the convoy vehicles. Rage-Ceele chief said one of AMISOM soldier was injured in the attack but no neutral sources could confirm the exact figure of AMISOM casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Danow village (16km W of Marka) in the morning of 13/11. The device reportedly exploded after the convoy passed the place. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 15/11. The convoy stopped and blocked the road after the explosion. One AMISOM vehicle was badly damaged in the explosion. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM convoy transporting logistics to Baidoa in Burjeedka (8km E of Baidoa) in the evening of 21/11. The convoy stayed overnight at the scene, following damaged inflicted by the blast in to one of their carrier and reached Baidoa safely in the following morning. The communication network was suspended from morning up to 14:00, to avoid further targeted explosions.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A war plane belonging to Kenya Defence forces conducted an airstrike against Eil Ad village (26km NW of Kismaayo) in the morning of 22/11. Reports indicate that the target was al Shabaab fighters but information suggests that unspecified numbers of nomads were killed and no al Shabaab fighter was killed - injuries among them not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya-AMISOM warplanes bombed Marerey village (90km NE of Afmadow), which is under the control of al Shabaab fighters in the afternoon of 25/11. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan-AMISOM warplanes bomb Hargeysa Yare village, causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan-AMISOM jets launch bombing attacks of the al Shabaab locations of (H)Fanoole and Hargeysa Yare south of Jilib. 49 Al-Shabab fighters among them senior commanders of the group are confirmed to have been killed in the airstrikes.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan-AMISOM jets launch bombing attacks of the al Shabaab locations of (H)Fanoole and Hargeysa Yare south of Jilib. 49 Al-Shabab fighters among them senior commanders of the group are confirmed to have been killed in the airstrikes.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan AMISOM air forces carry out a strike against several al Shabaab positions on Kudhaa island. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan warplanes bombed Jamaame town which is under the control of al Shabaab fighters in the afternoon of 27/11. No casualties were reported but a number of houses were destroyed in the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya-AMISOM defence war planes conducted third airstrike in three days against al Shabaab locations in Hargeysa Yare (10km SW of Jilib) in the afternoon of 27/11. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM supply convoy in Lafoole settlement (Afgooye District) in the morning of 03/12. A fuel tanker was damaged in the explosion. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED planted during the overnight hours accidentally exploded in the centre of Qansax Dhere in the morning of 11/12. The device exploded at a time when AMISOM/EOD team was dismantling it. One AMISOM soldier was killed and two others were wounded. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers fired six projectiles at Mogadishu Airport from Adan Kukay neighbourhood (Wadajir-Medina District) in the night of 14/12. The rounds landed in the AMISOM protected area of MIA. Local residents reportedly said several young men in a Toyota spotted in the area are believed to have been behind the attack. No casualties or damages were reported. The attackers escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at an AMISOM military convoy at Bundo Bilan in Ruusiya neighbourhood of Marka in the afternoon of 15/12. Casualties could not be established. The attackers escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Dec 16. Unidentified persons attacked Amisom [African Union Mission in Somalia] troops in Marka town with a hand grenade. No reported casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Heavily armed al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNG forces near Robow Village (20km NE of Baraawe) on the 17/12. The attack was initiated with a detonation of a RCIED followed by direct confrontation. The convoy was escorting a food convoy heading to Baraawe. One truck was damaged. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A roadside bomb targeted AMISOM forces in Marka. It is still unknown how many people were killed or injured in the blast. Security forces carried out an operation and arrested several people in connection with the explosion, though the identities of the perpetrators remained unreported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED explosion targeted AMISOM convoy passing Ceymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 02/01. The explosion reportedly missed the vehicle and no casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM (KDF) food supply convoy in Yoontoy Yare Village (27km N of Kismaayo) in the morning of 27/01. There are no reports of casualties or damages and the convoy continued with its journey.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED reportedly aimed at an AMISOM convoy detonated in Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 01/02. No gunfire fire was reported after the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: RCIED explosion targeted AMISOM convoy passing near Mariin-Gubaay Village (48km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 15/02. The explosion reportedly slightly damaged an AMISOM vehicle. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against AMISOM base near Sarta Minashiibiyo (Marka) in the morning of 16/02. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED exploded near a water dam in Kolbiyow, 33 KM SW of Badhaadhe on 03/02 where JLF and AMISOM forces fetch usually water. Property damage, but no human casualties reported. Perpetrators are unknown and no arrests were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED attack reportedly targeted an AMISOM convoy returning from Yoontooy village after fetching water in Buulo Gaduud (30km NE of Kismayo) in the morning of 06/06. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An al Shabaab-planted roadside bomb damages four AMISOM vehicles. Additionally, several soldiers were killed and others were injured in the attack - no numbers provided.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unknown attackers threw a hand grenade at AMISOM convoy passing Sheekh Abroone neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 16/03. The hand grenade missed its intended target and hit a young boy walking nearby and killed him.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED supposedly targeting an AMISOM convoy exploded in the vicinity of Ceel Saliini Village (32km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 07/04 and missed the target. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Two RCIED explosions took place at Dayniile Junction in the vicinity of the former Jaale Siyad Military Academy (Dayniile District) in the morning of 12/04. The explosions happened just after a AMISOM/SNG military convoy guarding the SNG president passed the area. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The president was travelling to Dayniile to attend a ceremony marking the 55th anniversary of Somali army at the former Defence Ministry.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED exploded in the vicinity of Ceel-Wareegow village (11km NE of Marka) in the morning of 13/04. An AMISOM convoy heading to Mogadishu was passing the road when the incident happened. No casualties or vehicle damages were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Ceelasha Biyaha. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No injuries reported, perpetrators unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy detonated near Bilan Bridge in Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 02/05. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. Reports indicate that an AMISOM truck was damaged in the explosion. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: An AMISOM/KDF convoy was hit by a RCIED explosion in Kolbiyow, 33 KM SW of Badhaadhe District in the morning of 08/05. One Caspir was damaged in the explosion and four KDF soldiers were injured. The convoy proceeded after the attack and no other incident was reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: KDF forces, based in Khadijo Hagi (42 KM NW of Belet Xaawo) shelled areas around Gaddoondhowe (43 KM NW of Belet Xaawo) in the morning of 01/06. Casualties cannot be confirmed. The shelling came after reports were circulating about al Shabaab troop movements in the area.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces based in Jowhar airstrip fired several mortar rounds against al Shabaab hideouts in Cali Fool Dheere area (21km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 02/06. The artillery attack followed after AMISOM Forces received information regarding al Shabaab movements in the targeted area. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM [African Unions Mission in Somalia] troops that are based at the Jowhar airport are said to have shelled a number of localities outside the town of Mahadaay in Middle Shabelle where Al-Shabab fighters are said to have been based. Causalities, date not clear: source dated 03/06.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 07/06. The convoy was heading towards Mogadishu when the incident happened. One AMISOM Caspir was reportedly damaged by the explosion. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab suicide bomber targets an armoured AMISOM-Ethiopian convoy on the outskirts of Buur Hakaba, Bay Region. Reports claims a number of Ethiopian forces were killed, while others were injured in the attack. No numbers provided.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeting an ENDF/AMISOM contingent convoy near Goof gadud village (30 KM NW of Baidoa) on 20/06 that was coming from Wajiid and was heading to Baidoa. The blast did not cause any damage or casualties

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab attackers shelled at least four mortar rounds at AMISOM base inside Mogadishu Stadium (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 10/07. Another two mortar shells also landed in the vicinity of Villa Somalia. SNG did not release any statement on the mortar attack. The mortars are believed to be fired from the outskirts of Mogadishu. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF convoy was targeted with an IED, which exploded in Qansax Dheere shortly before the convoy reached the place on 12/07. No casualties were reported. All communication was switched off in Baidoa since early morning as a ENDF convoy left from Baidoa for Burhakaba.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An ENDF convoy was targeted with an IED in Aawdiinle (30 KM NE of Baidoa) on 12/07. One casualty was reported on ENDF side who was transferred to hospital for treatment.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired about 5 rounds of mortars against AMISOM base in Qansax Dheere in the early morning of 13/07. No casualties were reported and the attackers withdrew.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF military operations against Al-Shabaab were continuing in Qansax Dheere and surrounding villages in the morning of 14/07. Mortar fire is heard outside Qansax Dheere. ENDF forces shelled Bulo Gumar village (8 km and Buulo-Masaajid 10Km SW of Qansax Dheere) respectively, said to be military bases for al Shabaab. The artillery/mortar attack from ENDF hit a house in Buulo Gumar Village where two children and their mother were killed; in Buulo-Masaajid village no injuries/dead were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 15/07. The explosion reportedly missed the target as the device exploded after the convoy passed. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: A SVBIED rammed into an ENDF convoy and SNFG troops heading to Diinsoor district in Dharqo (45 KM SW of Baidoa) on 19/07. Two SNGF died in the attack but 6 killed ENDF cannot be verified.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A SVBIED rammed into an ENDF convoy in Lulaaye (40 KM SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 19/07. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An air strike against al Shabaab fighters was conducted in Doodaale village (79 KM SW of Buur Hakaba on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that some al Shabaab fighters were killed and a battle wagon destroyed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Allied forces conducted airstrikes in Bisiq Cadde (51 KM SW of Buur Hakaba) and Barariya (28 KM SE of Buur Hakaba) before noon on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the target were al Shabaab fighters, travelling from Diinsoor into Buur Hakaba District. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Allied forces conducted airstrikes in Bisiq Cadde (51 KM SW of Buur Hakaba) and Barariya (28 KM SE of Buur Hakaba) before noon on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the target were al Shabaab fighters, travelling from Diinsoor into Buur Hakaba District. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in Cambarey Village (45km SW of Marka) in the morning of 20/07. One of the AMISOM vehicles was damaged by the explosion. Human casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM jets on 21/07 launched air raids against Al-Shabaab camps in areas near the town of Dinsor in southern Somalia. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Kenya (2013-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Reports indicate that KDF and ENDF forces using helicopters bombarded the outskirts of Bardheere to provide air support to the advancing AMISOM/SNGF troops. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy was targeted with a RCIED in Xaawo Cabdi on 24/07. Perpetrators escaped and no casualties were reported; vehicle damaged.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Attack helicopters (ENDF) launched an airstrike against Dalan Doole village (approx. 60 KM NE of Buur Hakaba) in the afternoon of 24/07. Reports indicate that around 15 civilians were killed and some al Shabaab vehicles destroyed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Attack helicopters (ENDF) bombarded Sigle (approx. 75 KM NE of Buur Hakaba) late afternoon of 24/07. The village was bombarded after some al Shabaab fled from Dalan Doole (approx. 60 KM NE of Buur Hakaba). Reports indicate that many civilians including women and children are killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters bombarded three villages in Baidoa district on 29/07. Main target were said to be moving al Shabaab vehicles concentrated around Lo Gaddud (20 KM S of Baidoa), Baanyaale (20 KM SE of Baidoa) and Haawa Dhaysile (approx. 27 KM SE of Baidoa).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters bombarded three villages in Baidoa district on 29/07. Main target were said to be moving al Shabaab vehicles concentrated around Lo Gaddud (20 KM S of Baidoa), Baanyaale (20 KM SE of Baidoa) and Haawa Dhaysile (approx. 27 KM SE of Baidoa).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters bombarded three villages in Baidoa district on 29/07. Main target were said to be moving al Shabaab vehicles concentrated around Lo Gaddud (20 KM S of Baidoa), Baanyaale (20 KM SE of Baidoa) and Haawa Dhaysile (approx. 27 KM SE of Baidoa).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF attack helicopters bombarded Daudow village (6 KM S of Baidoa) in the morning of 29/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that 9 al Shabaab fighters were wounded together with two civilians.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeting an AMISOM convoy in Rusiya neighbourhood of Marka town on 31/07. A water rowser was completely damaged during the explosion but AMISOM casualties are unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters carried out air bombardment in Makuudo Village (8 KM SW of Baidoa) late night of 01/08. The village was bombarded after reports indicated that some al Shabaab fighters have arrived in the village. Al Shabaab fighters are said to have managed to escape in the bush and no casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters were bombarding Bisiq cadde (51 KM SW of Buur Hakaba) in the afternoon of 01/08. There are reports of civilian casualties which cannot be independently confirmed. The targets of the bombings not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters were bombarding Buulo Fulaay (41 KM SW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 01/08. There are reports of civilian casualties which cannot be independently confirmed. The target of the bombings are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF attack helicopters launched an airstrike against Dalan Doole village (approx. 60 KM NE of Buur Hakaba) in the afternoon of 03/08. The target is believed to be al Shabaab. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM aircraft launch attacks on al Shabaab locations at Warhole village near Ceelbuur. Several causalities reported, numbers not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF helicopters attacked Tabarow (42 KM NW of Baidoa) in the early afternoon of 10/08. Casualties cannot be verified but rumours indicate that several al Shabaab fighters including a foreign fighter were killed in their vehicles.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Ethiopian-AMISOM forces launch an aerial bombardment against Booko settlement, Hiiraan region. 98 deaths suspected. Date not known, source dated (11/08).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy on its way to Mogadishu was targeted with a suspected al Shabaab RCIED in Boodboodka, entrance of Afgooye town on 18/08. AMISOM troops opened fire in the direction of the explosion. One civilian by-stander, who is believed to be a westerner, was killed and a Caspir damaged. AMISOM casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF attack helicopters conducted an airstrike in Messagit Mohamed Omar village (22 KM SW of Ceel Dheer) on 17/08. Supposedly two al Shabaab vehicles and their occupants were killed or destroyed. Exact details are unknown as Ceel Dheer is since many years uncontested under the control of al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
NOTES: Between sixteen and twenty AMISOM solders are killed in an al Shabaab suicide car bomb attack at a Jubaland army base in Kismayo on the morning of 22/08. The two inhabitants of the car were also killed in the blast. The number of dead was raised to 25 in the following week.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeting an ENDF convoy 3 KM outside Raabdhuure on the road to Buur Dhuxunley in the morning of 23/08. In the explosion, two ENDF were injured. ENDF opened fire after the detonation of the device, killing two civilians in the vicinity.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A hand grenade was thrown at AMISOM foot patrol by unknown attackers in Janaale (14 KM NW of Marka) on 28/08. No injuries were reported and perpetrators managed to escape.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM convoy was attacked with a RCIED in Ceel-Jaale (6 KM SW of Marka) on 05/09. The recovery team sealed off the area after the explosion. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A SVBIED rammed into an AMISOM recovery convoy in Garshiin (9 KM NW of Marka) on 05/09. Reports indicate that 2 AMISOM soldiers were killed, one injured and one Caspir was damaged in the explosion.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM troops, accompanying AMISOM convoy after conducting reconnaissance, fired mortar rounds against an al Shabaab position in south of Garasiyaani (55 KM north of Bulo Burte) and al Shabaab position close to Halgan (41 KM north of Bulo Burte). Al Shabaab retreated and the convoy is expected to reach Bulo Burte the next day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM troops, accompanying AMISOM convoy after conducting reconnaissance, fired mortar rounds against an al Shabaab position in south of Garasiyaani (55 KM north of Bulo Burte) and al Shabaab position close to Halgan (41 KM north of Bulo Burte). Al Shabaab retreated and the convoy is expected to reach Bulo Burte the next day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab militants have fired mortar rounds at a military base belonging to the African Union peacekeeping troops in Somalia in the Leego area. No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unknown number of African Union peacekeepers have been injured after their convoy hit a landmine in the southern town of Afgooye. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: ENDF Air force conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab fighters in Bush Madina (approx. 38 KM SE of Diinsoor) in the afternoon of 16/09. Casualties of the airstrike cannot be confirmed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM convoy was targeted with an IED on the road near Danow (16 KM NW of Marka) and Gol-Weyne (21 KM SW of Marka) on 20/09. No casualties were reported and one convoy vehicle was damaged.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a mortar attack against SNGF/ENDF base in Waajid on 20/09. They withdrew immediately and no casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: AMISOM/ENDF warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab bases in Labaatan Jirow Village (48km NE of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 21/09. Military officials said that an unspecified number of al Shabaab fighters were killed in the airstrike.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a group of AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol in Beyturaas neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 29/09. One AMISOM soldier was injured in the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A number of artillery or mortar rounds landed in villages under Qoryooley town in the night of 01/10. The AMISOM forces based in Danow (Marka District) were reportedly behind these attacks. The target of the AMISOM forces is unclear. The mortar attacks damaged the farms but no human casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in Mariin-Gubaay Village (Baraawe District) on 15/10. The explosion reportedly damaged one of the lorries of AMISOM. Human casualties remain unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces in Marka reportedly fired artillery guns to unidentified direction in the night of 17/10. The target of the artillery is currently is unclear since they were being fired outside the town.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack to Baardhere airport with mortar gun fire in the mid night 24/10. Currently the airport is a military base for ENDF, who fired back. The exchange of gun fire between the combatants resulted in an undetermined number of civilian casualties. Casualties of both sides are unconfirmed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An IED targeting ENDF/SNG forces convoy near Babaa village (15km SW of Luuq) in the morning of 29/10. The device missed its target and exploded after the convoy passed it. The convoy was coming from Luuq and heading to Yurkud when the incident happened.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya Defence Forces(KDF) conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab positions in Wadajir and Dalayad villages (38kmNE and 25km N of Badhaadhe) respectively on 01/11. As a result of the airstrikes 17 al Shabaab fighters including two senior commanders were allegedly killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya Defence Forces(KDF) conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab positions in Wadajir and Dalayad villages (38kmNE and 25km N of Badhaadhe) respectively on 01/11. As a result of the airstrikes 17 al Shabaab fighters including two senior commanders were allegedly killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A rocket believed to be RPG landed inside an AMISOM base in Sarta Minashibiyo (Marka) in the morning of 01/11. AMISOM forces in the camp opened gunfire in to different directions in retaliation to the attack. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted against an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Ceel-Jaale (5km SW of Marka) in the morning of 05/11. The convoy came from Ceel-Jaale and was heading to Shalaambood when the incident happened. Local residents confirmed death and injuries of AMISOM forces (unknown numbers) as well as damage to of one of their vehicles.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Civilians (Somalia)
NOTES: An IED targets a passing AMISOM convoy on 09/11, killing a civilian woman.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A remote-controlled roadside bomb targeted a AMISOM convoy in Heliwa, perpetrators not known. Causalities reported, numbers not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeted at an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Ex-Control Balcad (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 19/11. The explosion reportedly damaged one of the vehicles in the convoy. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A remote blast targeted AMISOM soldiers in Balcad, causalities reported, though numbers of dead not known. Al Shabaab are the suspected perpetrators.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM troops on foot patrol in the vicinity of the fish market (Marka) in the morning of 21/11. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeted against newly trained ISWA soldiers who were doing a joint military exercise with ENDF near Nation-Link Telecommunication company office in Qasaxdhere in the morning of 24/11. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A military convoy belonging to African Union troops in Somalia (AMISOM) have been targeted in double bomb blasts in the southern Somali coastal town of Marka on 25/11. Casualties believed, though numbers not immediately known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeted against an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Golweyn Village (21km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 01/12. The explosion reportedly destroyed an AMISOM oil tanker. AMISOM forces captured and killed three civilian bystanders in retaliation of the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired at least six mortar rounds at Maslax base - an AMISOM military base - (Heliwa District) in the night of 01/12. Reports indicate that the mortars were reportedly fired from the northern direction of the compound. Casualties are could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: ISIL: Islamic State of Iraq and Levant
NOTES: AMISOM-Kenyan aircraft bombed Yaraa Lafagari and Diif in Lower Juba region, where members of the pro-Islamic State [ISIL/ISIS] Al-Shabab faction are based. It is reported that al Shabaab/ISIL sustained causalities, though specific numbers are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: ISIL: Islamic State of Iraq and Levant
NOTES: AMISOM-Kenyan aircraft bombed Yaraa Lafagari and Diif in Lower Juba region, where members of the pro-Islamic State [ISIL/ISIS] Al-Shabab faction are based. It is reported that al Shabaab/ISIL sustained causalities, though specific numbers are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan warplanes targeted al Shabaab convoy near Yora village (65km S of Afmadow) on 05/12. The convoy was transporting an unspecified number of al Shabaab fighters and at least one vehicle was destroyed. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: An AMISOM-Kenyan convoy hits an al Shabaab in Dhobley killing five soldiers.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces based in Jowhar airstrip reportedly fired several mortar rounds against IDP camp in the outskirt of Jowhar in the night 12/12. The motive behind the shelling is not known. Three people were injured from the explosions.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in Gol-Weyn town (22km W of Marka) in the afternoon of 18/12. The explosion was followed by armed confrontation between the AMISOM forces and al Shabaab attackers. The exchange of gunfire lasted for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. AMISOM forces in Gol-Weyn later opened gunfire against a public mini-bus which was moving along the road and killed five passengers on spot in retaliation for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Unknown perpetrators hurled a hand grenade against AMISOM base in Sarta Minashibiyo in Marka on 20/12. The device exploded but no casualties were reported and perpetrators managed to escape.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeting AMISOM convoy exploded in Caymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 22/12. AMISOM forces opened fire and sealed off the area in response to the blast. The explosion damaged one vehicle but casualties are currently unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan aircraft bomb al Shabaab location at Beexaani, outside of Kismayo. Seven civilians were believed to be killed unintentionally by the strike. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces in Marka Town fired artillery and mortars to Janaale and Ceel Haji in the night of 23/12. No casualties were reported. Related, AMISOM forces left Ceel Haji in the morning of 23/12 and al Shabaab fighters occupied it in the afternoon.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces in Marka Town fired artillery and mortars to Janaale and Ceel Haji in the night of 23/12. No casualties were reported. Related, AMISOM forces left Ceel Haji in the morning of 23/12 and al Shabaab fighters occupied it in the afternoon.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: An IED of unknown origin exploded in Kulbiyow (33km SW of Badhaadhe) targeting a KDF rotation convoy on 30/12. First reports indicate that one KDF vehicle was damaged by the explosion but human casualties are expected but are not known so far. The KDF convoy was on its way to Badhaadhe.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted AMISOM/KDF convoy heading to Afmadow on its way from Dhoobley in Hawina (approx. 90km SW of Afmadow) in the morning of 04/01. One vehicle was damaged and three KDF soldiers were injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A powerful explosion hit a Kenyan convoy passing the road linking Dhooblay district and Taabto area in Lower Jubba. The blast killed a Kenyan commander and about 10 of his escorts, and forced the convoy to be stranded at the scene of the attack for several hours.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab detonate a roadside bomb targeting a AMISOM convoy in the Shalaamboot region. The explosion caused damage to the vehicle.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AMISOM/KDF contingent attacked using artillery and mortar fire against a group of al Shabaab fighters spotted near Bula Gaduud Village (30km NE of Kismaayo) in the evening of 13/01.The attack lasted for about three hours and no casualties were reported from al Shabaab side so far.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF helicopters bombed a grazing area approximately 20km NE of Hoosingow (Badhaadhe District) in the afternoon of 26/01. The area is inhabited by pastoralists and casualties are unknown. The specific target of the KDF is not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: An IED hit a KDF convoy in Kolbiyow (33km SW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 27/01. Initial reports indicate that one KDF was killed and nine others wounded while one APC was damaged. Helicopters from Kismaayo are said to have flown to the area to medevac the injured soldiers to Dhobley.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab bases near Golaa and Naxariis villages (18km and 30km NE of Buale) as well as Sokela Village(48km E of Buale) in the afternoon of 08/02. The exact number of casualties are unknown but local residents have reported to have seen dead bodies of two farmers believed to have been killed by stray bullets from one of the targeted al Shabaab bases. They also confirmed a thick smoke hovering over the targeted bases. Al Shabaab warned residents not to visit the area and the villages along the eastern and the southern sides of the River Juba. Later reports (Daily Nation) indicate 53 members of al Shabaab, including a top commander were killed in the strike.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab bases near Golaa and Naxariis villages (18km and 30km NE of Buale) as well as Sokela Village(48km E of Buale) in the afternoon of 08/02. The exact number of casualties are unknown but local residents have reported to have seen dead bodies of two farmers believed to have been killed by stray bullets from one of the targeted al Shabaab bases. They also confirmed a thick smoke hovering over the targeted bases. Al Shabaab warned residents not to visit the area and the villages along the eastern and the southern sides of the River Juba.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab bases near Golaa and Naxariis villages (18km and 30km NE of Buale) as well as Sokela Village (48km E of Buale) in the afternoon of 08/02. The exact number of casualties are unknown but local residents have reported to have seen dead bodies of two farmers believed to have been killed by stray bullets from one of the targeted al Shabaab bases - later reports (Associated Press) confirm that an al Shabaab commander (Abdirahim Mohamed Warsame) and 10 others were killed in the strike. They also confirmed a thick smoke hovering over the targeted bases. Al Shabaab warned residents not to visit the area and the villages along the eastern and the southern sides of the River Juba.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenyan air forces launch air strikes on al Shabaab locations on Berhani village. Any causalities have yet to be established. Strikes were also launched in Jubbada Hoose, near Kismayo.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrike against al Shabaab base at Berhani Village (approx. 45km NW of Kismaayo) in the morning of 09/02. The warplanes carried out repeated airstrikes against the same point. Reports indicate that there was unspecified numbers of casualties including death and injuries from al Shabaab side. Further reports indicate one of the warplanes 'a helicopter' landed briefly at the targeted area but it is not clear what they picked from the scene.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces based in Qoryooley town fired mortar rounds and heavy artilleries against al Shabaab hideouts in the vicinity of Camp II (approx. 10km NW of Qoryooley) in the afternoon of 09/02. Reports indicate that the shelling also affected civilian population in the area. Two civilians were confirmed dead in the attack while livestock and other properties were also damaged.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired at least six mortar rounds at MIA in the morning of 11/02. It is not clear where these mortar rounds were fired from but it is believed that it was a close proximity to the airport. Two Ugandan soldiers were injured in the attack, though it is not clear if they were the target of the attack. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: An IED of unknown origin targeted Burundian contingent of AMISOM at Via-Afmadow of Shaqalaha neighbourhood in Kismaayo in on the afternoon of 13/02. No casualties reported as the IED missed the target and exploded before the convoy passed. Security operation is on-going but so far, no arrests were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds against AMISOM/SNA camps in Shalaambood (5km NW of Marka) in the night of 15/02. Reports indicate that the mortars were fired from Janaale direction. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED of unknown origin targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Mariin-Gubaay (50km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 17/02. One of the convoy vehicles was damaged by the explosion. A Somali driver was reportedly injured in the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Ceel-Wareegow (11km NE of Marka town) in the afternoon of 27/02. AMISOM soldier was injured in the blast while the explosion also damaged an AMISOM vehicle.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired at least three rounds of mortar fire against the new airport in Kismaayo on 27/02. At least three rounds landed inside KDF protected area. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces based in Buufow Bacaad fired unknown number of mortar rounds at Janaale town (14km NW of Marka) and the neighbouring villages in the night of 05/03. According to local reports, the mortars caused unspecified number of civilian injuries. The intended target is not clear.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Explosions from unknown origin target Ethiopian forces in Baardheere on 05/03. Of the three dead two were civilians. It is not clear if the perpetrators were at the scene or the explosives were IEDs.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Motor rounds landed in Via-Afmadow, Shaqaalaha neighbourhood in Kismaayo town in the morning of 08/02. The motors hit in an open place inside a civilian compound and no casualties were reported. The motors are said to have targeted an AMISOM (Burundian) base near Via-Afmadow.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A KDF convoy was targeted with an IED in Gulshu, a farmland located between Kolbiyow and Raskambooni along the border (approx. 45km SW of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 17/03. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces in Shalaambood fired mortars against civilian populated areas in Abiikarow (13km W of Marka) in the night of 18/03. The mortars landed on a pastoralist family and reportedly injured a civilian while also killing a large number of goats. The incident was confirmed also by Shalaambood chief but AMISOM did not comment on this.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Reports indicate a refugee returnees convoy from Kenya Dadaab camp have survived air booming conducted by suspected Kenyan fighters Jets near Waraha Dhobley (approx. 100km SW of Bu'aale). No human and property damage reported from the scene and returnees proceeded with their travel the following day safely. The targets of the bombing are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan war planes targeted al Shabaab bases at Beer Yamaarug (65km SW of Bu'aale town) on 22/03. Residents report there were repeated airstrikes at this location which is deep in the bush. Casualties are unknown because the area is a closed zone for al Shabaab fighters and pastoralists are banned from using roads leading to it for grazing.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya air forces launch attacks against al Shabaab near Jilib. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Kenya air forces launch attacks against al Shabaab near Baadhaade. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted against ENDF convoy in the vicinity of Ceel-Laheley (Ceel Bur District) in the morning of 28/03. The device reportedly hit a vehicle and destroyed it. The convoy was travelling between Dhusamareeb and Ceel-Bur when the incident happened. Sources confirmed casualties although the exact figures are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A road-side bomb from unknown origin exploded, targeting Ethiopian forces in Berdale on 29/03. Five deaths, other wounded reported

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces fired artillery/mortar rounds from Leego (48km SE of Buur-Hakaba) in the morning of 30/03 following fears of possible attacks by al Shabaab fighters from that area. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces in Buufow Bacaad fired unconfirmed rounds of mortar fire against al Shabaab positions in Janaale Village and surrounding suburbs in the morning of 02/03. Most civilians displaced from the affected villages. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An AMISOM/ENDF contingent conducted a security operation along the road between Mabaax (86km NE of Jalalaqsi) and Adan Yabaal in the morning of 06/04. The convoy was hit by an IED of unknown origin near Mabaax village. Three soldiers were injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Km 60 (27km NE of Marka) in the evening of 09/04. The explosion reportedly destroyed a water tanker. The convoy came from Mogadishu and was heading towards Buulo Mareer when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired six mortar rounds against the AMISOM base in Danow Village (16km W of Marka) in the morning of 09/04. Two rounds landed inside the base causing an unknown number of casualties, while the remaining four landed outside the base injuring three women. Sources confirmed that AMISOM evacuated injured soldiers together with the three civilian women by air. AMISOM forces fired back mortars after the attack but no details are available.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A land mine plated at Aawdiinle by al Shaabab detonates, killing six Ethiopian soldiers, including a commander.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: The Islamic State (IS) section in Somalia issued a statement claiming responsibility for their first attack in Somalia. The statement, circulated on social media, declared that its fighters detonated an IED against an AMISOM vehicle in the vicinity of Tredisha.(km13 on the Afgoye road) in the outskirts of Mogadishu, on 26/04. The authors of the communique admitted not knowing what the results of the attack were: death or injuries, or mere damage to the vehicle. The African Union Mission representative in Somalia, Lt. Col. Joe Kibet, admitted that an IED had struck a convoy of six vehicles moving from a Ugandan AMISOM forward operating base towards Mogadishu International Airport but stated that the explosion had missed its target and caused no damage whatsoever. This was confirmed by Abdikamil Moalim Shukri, speaking for Somalia's Ministry of Internal Security. This statement marks the first time IS officially assumes authorship for an attack in Somalia.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED exploded in Garasiyani village (55km NW of Bulo Burte) in the afternoon of 26/04. The device detonate in a shade where AMISOM (unknown origin) convoys usually stops between Beled Weyne and Halgan. Two civilians were injured and taken to Beled Weyne for treatment.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Two civilians are injured after a roadside bomb struck an AMISOM-ENDF convoy in Nuur Fanaax (Nuur Fanah). A truck was reported destroyed. It is not clear if there were any AMISOM causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Unknown attackers hurled two hand grenades against an AMISOM/SNGF post in Ruusia neighborhood on 01/05. The grenades failed to hit the intended target but instead injured three civilian bystanders. SNGF started a security operation after the attack but no arrest was reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: An AMISOM supply convoy was targeted with an IED at Ex-Control Balcad on 02/05 afternoon. A vehicle was damaged by the explosion and no other casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Reports indicate that six mortar rounds were fired by Al Shabaab and hit Kismaayo airport. So far no casualties were reported and Kenyan AMISOM are firing artillery back in the suspected direction.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted a AMISOM convoy near Roobow village (22km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 15/05. The convoy was heading to Baraawe town when the incident happened. One of the AMISOM vehicles was damaged by the blast. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: A RCIED exploded in Xaawa-Cabdi locality (9km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 18/05. Reports indicate that a AMISOM convoy was passing when the device exploded, but it missed the target. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired six rounds of 82mm mortar bombs against AMISOM base at Bulo Burto (c. 120 km South of Beletweyne town). It was reported that the mortars missed the target and landed outside Hegal FOB AMISOM defence position. There were no reports of causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab targets Ethiopian forces with an IED in Garass America village, Luuq District. Casualties not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An al Shabaab roadside bombing against AMISOM-ENDF forces in Yurkud kills three soldiers on 28/05.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: A convoy transporting Kenyan defence forces (KDF) was targeted in a roadside bomb explosion outside Liboi town near Somali border on 03/06. The bomb blast has destroyed one of vehicles in the convoy, causing unidentified casualties. Al Shabaab are beloved responsible.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired three mortar bombs at an AMISOM location resulting in the injury of an AMISOM soldier and the destruction of a UN bus.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: On 11 June, in Merka an IED targeting an AMISOM convoy detonated killing one AMISOM soldier and injuring two others. One AMISOM lorry was also damaged by the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM Convoy moving from Afgoye and heading towards number 50km exploded at Adow Dibile vicinity (08km West of Afgoye district). One AMISOM truck was damaged by the explosion as eyewitness confirmed. One soldier killed in the blast. Following the blast several soldiers pursued the fleeing attackers, killing two.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Mortar fires hit Ethiopian defences in Halgan district in Hiiraan region. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A vehicle was burned, 11 Ethiopian soldiers killed and more that number wounded following an al Shabaab bomb explosion on the outskirts of Ufurow in Bay region.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: An RCIED targeting an ENDF/SNA convoy heading to Qansax-Dheere exploded at Shanta Mundul (approx. 10kms SW of Qansax-Dheere district). Casualties are not known and the convoy reportedly proceed to Qansax-Dheere district.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: An RCIED reportedly targeting an AMISOM Convoy moving from Shalamboot and heading towards Buulo Mareer town exploded at Golweyn vicinity in Kurtunwarey (90km West of Mogadishu). At least two AMISOM soldiers were reportedly killed and one AMISOM convoy vehicle damaged by the explosion. No comment from AMISOM regarding this incident but al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Based in Shalaambood, al Shabaab fired long range mortar shells at AMISOM positions in Buufow causing causalities of unknown number. In response, AMISOM forces launched shells to the al Shabaab position. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Based in Shalaambood, al Shabaab fired long range mortar shells at AMISOM positions in Buufow causing causalities of unknown number. In response, AMISOM forces launched shells to the al Shabaab position. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Suspected al-Shabaab fighters have fired several mortar rounds at Ethiopian military base in Halgan village. At least one civilian reported dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A roadside bomb blast reportedly hit an African Union force convoy travelling near Mahaday town in Middle Shabelle region. Al Shabaab suspected as perpetrator.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Reports from Bay and Bakool Regions indicate that al-Shabab fighters have shelled bases belonging to Ethiopian troops in the towns of Wajid and Diinsoor. Several injuries reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Reports from Bay and Bakool Regions indicate that al-Shabab fighters have shelled bases belonging to Ethiopian troops in the towns of Wajid and Diinsoor. Several injuries reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A remote controlled IED targets an AMISOM-ENDF convoy at Rab Dhuure. No reported deaths. Though no group has claimed responsibility the source suspects al Shabaab. Following the blast the soldiers opened fire at nearby residents, killing two civilians.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired six rounds of mortars targeting an ENDF base in the northern side of the town. They reportedly fired 82mm mortar rounds which landed outside the ENDF base. None of the mortars landed in the town. ENDF forces responded with artillery but no casualty was reported from the incident.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: A roadside bomb hit an AMNISOM convoy, destroying a troop transport vehicle. No fatalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: Al-Shabaab fighters shelled a US and Ugandan military base known as Number 60 Base in southern Somalia region of Lower Shabelle. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: AMISOM forces fire mortar shells at al Shabaab position in KM60 area, al Shabaab returns long-range fire. No reports of causality.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Up to a dozen mortar rounds were launched on various areas of Baidoa, destroying homes and causing one death and several injuries. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. AMISOM responded with artillery fire. Two al Shabaab reported dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted a AMISOM convoy in Heliwa. Two civilians were injured in the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: An al Shabaab IED targeted a AMISOM convoy outside of Wanla Weyne. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: The African Union forces (AMISOM) in Somalia are reportedly fired mortar rounds on residential areas near the southern port city of Marka on Tuesday, causing casualties. Al Shabaab is believed to have hideouts in the area, though the bombing were described as indiscriminate.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An IED targeted an AMISOM-ENDF convoy, damaging a truck. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: An IED targets an AMISOM convoy travelling between Buufow and Elwaregow damaging the vehicle. Causalities not known at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Several mortar rounds have landed near Halane compound in Wardhigley, which serves as the largest military base for African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) in Mogadishu on Thursday. Perpetrators not known. One civilian reported injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED planted between Elasha and El Arbaow detonated, damaging a AMISOM vehicle. No causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeted a AMISOM convoy outside of Ceel Waregow. Causalties and perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A suspected al Shabaab IED damages a AMISOM vehicle. Several arrests of suspected perpetrators occurred following the incident.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Marka District causing the damage to the vehicle.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An al Shabaab RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Ceelasha, damaging a vehicle. Following the explosion, AMISOM forces opened fire injuring three civilian bystandards.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al-Shabaab fired a number of mortars at a base belonging to Ethiopian troops in Halgan. No reported casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters have fired several mortar shells at an Ethiopian military base in El Ali area, Hiiraan region of central Somalia on Sunday mid night.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters shelled an AMISOM Djibouti base in Hawl Wadaag neighbourhood of Beled Weyne in the night of 04/10. More than ten rounds were fired against the base.
