The sound of the shelling created anxiety amongst local residents. No civilian casualties were reported, but, some houses have been affected due to close proximity to the base.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired about 5 mortar rounds against an AMSIOM base in Bufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 04/10. In response, AMISOM forces fired back at least two rounds of mortars in the direction where al Shabaab mortars were coming from. One of these mortars landed in a residence at Farango-Luunge village (10km NW of Marka) and reportedly killed five members of a family, including three children.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired about 5 mortar rounds against an AMSIOM base in Bufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 04/10. In response, AMISOM forces fired back at least two rounds of mortars in the direction where al Shabaab mortars were coming from. One of these mortars landed in a residence at Farango-Luunge village (10km NW of Marka) and reportedly killed five members of a family, including three children.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces launch mortars at an al Shabaab location near Janaale, five civilians reported dead. AMISOM later denied this claim.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: At least five people were injured on Saturday evening in a mortar attack on a residential area in Bulo Hubey. The attack was believed to be targeting a AMISOM base. No immediate claim of responsibility, though al Shabaab are expected as perpetrators.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab has launched an overnight mortar attack on military base belonging to Ethiopian forces in Ceel Cali. Reports of the casualties on Ethiopian forces from the mortar shelling remain unclear.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Seventeen Ethiopian forces were killed while several others were also wounded in an al Shabaab explosion attack that occurred in the outskirts of Baidoa town [southwest Somalia] on 13 October.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched several mortar rounds against AMISOM/SNAF positions in Qoryooley. A civilian was reported killed. AMISOM responded in suspected directions, casualties not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab conduct a mortar attack on a AMISOM base in Qoryooley on 17/10. AMISOM forces respond with mortar fire. Unconfirmed casualties reported, numbers not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched several mortar rounds against AMISOM/SNAF positions at K50 settlement. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: AS fighters fired two mortar rounds against AMISOM and SNGF bases' at Halane neighbourhood in Qoryooley town in the night of 19/10. In response, AMISOM fired two mortars towards the direction which they were suspecting AS were at the time. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targets passing AMISOM forces, injuring only a civilian. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces based in Buufow fired mortar rounds at al Shabaab positions in Janaale. Casualties not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Two rounds of mortars were fired against the AMISOM/Djiboutian base in the outskirt of Jalalaqsi town on 25/10. The AMISOM forces didn't respond to the attack and no civilian casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched several mortar shells at SNG/AMISOM positions in Xudur. At least 1 person was confirmed killed, and several injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected Kenya military jets have conducted an airstrike in southern Somalia, targeting an Al Shabaab training camp in Malenda. According to reports 'several' were killed in the airstrike.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A Somali official says al Shabaab has fired several of mortar bombs at a military outpost belonging to AU mission in Somalia (AMISOM) -Burundi in El-Baraf village, Mahadaay District. Five soldiers deaths reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS fighters fired about five rounds of mortars against Ceel Jaalle AMISOM base (approx. 6km SW of Marka) in the night of 06/11. In response, AMISOM shelled the nearby area with mortars. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS fighters fired about seven mortar rounds against an AMISOM base in Ceel Baraf (55km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 06/11. Casualties are unknown. There is no information from AMISOM regarding the incident.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: AS launched a mortar attack on an AMISOM base in Ceel Baraf (60km NE of Jowhar) on 08/11. AMISOM did not issue any statement regarding the incident. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A remote controlled IED targets an AMISOM convoy at Carbiska. One truck was damaged by the explosion. Human causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab carry out two land mine explosions in Buur Xakaba, first against military forces (AMISOM-Ethiopia), then against a police post the following morning. A senior government official was killed in the first attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: A number of mortar rounds were fired from an unknown location and landed in the vicinity of Mogadishu Stadium (Wardhiigleey District). AMISOM forces have a big base in the stadium. It is not yet known if the attack caused casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan Air Force jets have carried out an airstrike on al-Shabaab training camps at Luglaaw (Laan-Goori). Four deaths reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: AS fighters launched a number of mortar attacks against an SNA/AMISOM base in Miir Taqwo village (53km NE of Jowhar town) on 16/11 night. This occurs just a day after the joint AMISOM/SNA forces took over Miir Taqwo from the AS. The number of casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: At least three Ethiopian soldiers serving with the African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) have been killed in a IED bomb attack at Bulo-Gadud village. Perpetrators not known, though coalition forces had killed six members of al Shabaab the previous day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al-Shabaab has shelled an African Union military base in Leego area in southern Somalia. The African Union troops retaliated by firing artillery towards al-Shabab positions. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: A number of mortar rounds fired by AS fighters landed on an ENDF military base near Waajid Airport on 30/11. Casualties have not been reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launches mortar rounds against Ethiopian forces in Waajid. Local residents in Wajid town said they heard sounds of several explosions from the mortar shelling landed in the camp, but reported no casualties from the attack. The attack may have occurred on 04/12.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Three civilians are killed in a al Shabaab-targeted bombing of 'rural Lower Shebelle' - location not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: At least four Kenyan defence force soldiers were killed, several injured in a bomb attack on KDF military convoy in southern Somalia on 07/12. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An al Shabaab IED strikes an AMISOM convoy at Bulo Mareer. Outcome unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An al Shabaab roadside bomb targets a AMISOM convoy near Bulo Mareer. Four AMISOM soldiers reported dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AMISOM forces are targeted with a roadside bomb while travelling between Tabta and Qoqani. Several soldiers are feared dead. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy is struck by an al Shabaab IED. One reported wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two simultaneous blasts ripped through a convoy carrying AU soldiers serving with AMISOM near Mahaday district in Middle Shabelle region on 12/12. Sources said AMISOM convoy was targeted in remote-controlled land mine explosions as it drove between Biyo Adde and Mir Tuugo areas by al Shabaab. Two causalities reported. Al Shabaab believed responsible

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: AS fighters fired five mortar rounds against ENDF/SNA military base in Waajid from an unknown location in the morning of 13/12. Reports indicate that the ENDF responded with mortar fire in the direction of the attack. No civilian casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy struck an IED at Ceel Wareegow, badly damaging one of the convoy's vehicles in the evening of 17/12.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED attack targeted against an AMISOM convoy in Miirtaqwo village (53km NE of Jowhar) on 25/12 reportedly killed four AMISOM soldiers. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Burundian convoy travelling between Mir Taqwo and Biyo Cadde is struck by an al Shabaab RCIED. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected Kenyan war planes conducted repeated air strikes against an AS base in the outskirts of Kamjiroon Village (approx. 85km NW of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 26/12. The planes destroyed the AS base and killed unknown number of AS fighters, as area residents report.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED exploded around Biya-adde apparently targeting a AMISOM convoy. casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy was attacked with an IED in Biyo Cado village (36km NE of Jowhar) on 28/12. The explosion reportedly killed 5 soldiers and wounded one soldier. Perpetrators identity not mentioned.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: A remotely controlled IED was targeted against Djiboutian forces in Jalalaqsi on 28/12. The soldiers were on foot patrol when the incident happened. Local telecommunication networks were switched off after the explosion and joint AMISOM/SNA forces conducted house to house search in the town. AS claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED planted along the roadside of Afgoy road in Alamada village, apparently targeting AMISOM convoy heading to Mogadishu from Afgoy direction, exploded and hit one of the AMISOM vehicles which sustained minor damage. No other casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS fighters attacked an AMISOM convoy, traveling from Mogadishu to Bali Dogle, with an IED in Yaqbariweyne on 31/12. One of convoy's vehicles was damaged by the explosion. The number of casualties are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: RCIED planted along the roadside of Baidoa road in Idow Jalaad village, near Wanla Weyne, exploded and reportedly hit one of the AMISOM vehicles. Casualties could not be established. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
NOTES: A 'number' of African Union (Uganda) and Somali National army personnel are feared dead after their convoy was hit by a landmine in the outskirts of southern town of Bula Mareer. Perpetrators not known .

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED planted along the road between Shalanbood and Buula-mareer settlements apparently targeting AMISOM convoy travelling along that road exploded and hit one of the AMISOM trucks. Casualties could not be established.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A AMISOM patrol is hit by an al Shabaab laden IED. No deaths reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An al Shabaab IED strikes an AMISOM foot patrol. Two soldiers wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: A roadside bomb has hit a military convoy carrying US and Kenyan soldiers in the outskirts of southern Somalia city of Kimsayo. Witnesses said they saw a huge cloud of smoke rise from the scene, adding that one of the vehicles was destroyed by the blast. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility, stating they had 'killed US soldiers.' No specific numbers given. Any causalities were not confirmed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
NOTES: AMISOM launch an aerial bombardment on al Shabaab locations Buulo Gaduud. The commander of Africom explained that the bombardment was meant to aid Somali and African Union forces who were conducting military operation in the area. Casualties not known. The US had an advisory role during the operation.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED struck a AMISOM vehicle Alamada between Afgoye and Mogadishu, killing 12. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launched a mortar attack on AMISOM positions in Qoryooley, resulting in at least one civilian casualty.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab targets an AMISOM convoy in Mahaday at Miir-Taqwo. Damaged reported to a vehicle - casualties not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Two remote controlled roadside bombs strike two AMISOM-Burundi vehicles outside Biyo Cadde. No reported casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: An RCIED hit an AMISOM convoy in Heliwa, causing damages. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds against AMISOM forces at Roobow. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab militants and AMISOM clashed at Qoryoley district. AS fired mortar rounds into the city killing two civilians and injuring seven others in a mosque. AMISOM fired back at the AS position.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF conducted air strikes on an al Shabaab base at Showla Mareer, near Hosingow. Causalities unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces fired mortar shells to the outskirts of Golweyn in Marka district. It was reported that an AMISOM convoy was planning to travel towards that areas. The mortars landed in a farm. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. The targets of the shells were not described by the source.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AS fighters allegedly launched three mortar rounds into Qoryoley district. AMISOM responded with fire. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An RCIED targeting an ENDF convoy exploded outside Laanta Garaska village (Approx. 20kms N of Wajid district) on the road to Wajid district. Two ENDF soldiers were reportedly killed and one injured. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired several 82mm mortar rounds towards FOB Qoryoley, causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired one 60mm mortar round against AMISOM at K50. No causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An RCIED, targeting AMISOM Ethiopian contingent, exploded on the main road that links AMISOM and Beletweyne town located at the eastern part of Beletweyne city at a place known as Nurhawad. There were no reports of casualties or fatalities.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters conducted an IED attack against SNA/KDF convoy traveling from Abdibirole to Kismayo (c. 40 km South West of Kismayo). Initial reports indicated that one land cruiser was damaged, Two SNA were killed and four others were seriously injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces based in Buufow fired at least three mortar rounds to Janaale district, which was an AS controlled area. It was reported that the mortar shells landed on an empty area inside the city. One of the mortars impacted outside Nationlink company building causing no damage, the second mortar round landed at Koranic Madarasa while the third mortar round landed on a local AS station. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab target an AMISOM-KDF convoy with an IED near Afgooye. 'Some' causalities - numbers not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: An AMISOM-KDF convoy is hit by a al Shabaab land mind while travelling at Hawina, near Dhobley. Al Shabaab claims 14 dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: An IED detonates under a AMISOM convoy at Tabta. Causalities, damage incurred not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An IED planted on the road targeting an ENDF military vehicle convoy from Buur-Hakaba to Baidoa, exploded at Mooda-Mooda village (26Km SE of Baidoa). No casualties or damage reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An al Shabaab roadside blast kills at least three AMISOM soldiers at Mooda Mooda.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM troops fired mortar rounds into Ciid Ciid settlement 7KM from Mahaday district. Sources stated that al Shabaab fighters were preparing to attack AMISOM and SNA position when AMISOM troops launched the attack. Some AS fatalities and injuries were reported but no details were available.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: At least five mortar rounds fired from unknown location reportedly hit a military training facility near the military hospital in Hodan district. Unconfirmed reports indicate that one of the rounds impacted Jaalle siyad AMISOM base camp. Causalities are unknown. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fires several mortar rounds against a AMISOM base in Leego. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF convoy hit by an al Shabaab roadside IED, causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) troops fired mortar rounds towards suspected al Shabaab positions outside of Baraawe. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An Ethiopian convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED) in Ceel Qoxle. Perpetrators, causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy strikes an IED at Cabdow Dibile and K50. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility. Four dead between the two areas.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An explosive detonated near an AMISOM base in Leego. Casualties, perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: In Burhakaba, Al Shabaab carried out a mortar attack on AMISOM positions around midnight on 3 April. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy hit an IED in Kurtunwaarey. The soldiers errantly returned fire, errantly killing a civilian.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AM, Buulo Mareer, Lower Shabelle: an AMISOM convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: After an AMISOM transport is hit by an al Shabaab IED in Fito Dheer, near Wareer-Male. Soldiers opened fire at nearby civilians, killing two. A driver of one of the vehicles was reported dead from the initial blast. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the IED. This event may have occurred on 03/04.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: On 5 April, al Shabaab fighters launched a mortar attack against an AMISOM base in Ambareeso, Barawe district. Causalities/damages not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Three or four civilians were either killed or wounded in artillery cross fire between Al Shabaab and Amisom troops at Suta Beel which is ten kilometres from Barawe town. The rockets were believed to be aimed at a AMISOM base in Ambareeso. No reported combatant causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AM, Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 13:00EAT, Lanta Buuro, Lower Shabelle: an AMISOM convoy was hit by an al Shabaab roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Early AM, Kismayo district, Lower Jubba: Kenya Defence Force (KDF) aircraft conducted an airstrike against an al Shabaab camp in the vicinity of Kismayo at Kanjaron. Causalities not known. Conflicting, Shabelle Network believes the airstrike may have been carried out by the United States.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An al Shabaab roadside blast kills five Ugandan AMISOM soldiers along the road connecting Afgooye and Ceel Jaale. The following morning AMISOM confirmed the attack, though refuted the causality number.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 17 April, afternoon, Cambarrey, Lower Shabelle: an Ugandan AMISOM convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). No causalities reported. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Initial reports stated that KDF conducted an airstrike targeting al Shabaab training camp at Qabaa (c. 30 km East of Hosingo). An unconfirmed number of AS fighters were reported killed and the airstrike caused major destruction of the camp. It was confirmed that there was an AS training camp at the targeted location. AS fighters restricted access of the location to locals.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Seven Ugandan soldiers were attacked and killed by an al Shabaab IED in Yaaq Biri Weyne. The attack may have taken place the following day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 13:00EAT, IVO Mahaday, Middle Shabelle: an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy was hit by a al Shabaab roadside improvised explosive device (IED) near Mahaday. The resulting causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: An al Shabaab roadside bomb detonates at Haji Ali (near Adale) as Burundian troops were attempting to have a device dismantled. Three deaths reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A road side RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy travelling at Industrial road, SIMAD university neighbourhood, Wardhigley district. No casualties were reported. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 09 May, 20:30EAT, Awbocow, Lower Shabelle: al Shabaab fired mortar rounds against the AMISOM base of Awbocow. The rounds landed short of their target, killing two civilians. The mortar attack follows a general attack earlier in the day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 10 May, c. 1030 hrs. Two simultaneous RCIEDs planted alongside, targeting an AMISOM convoy moving from Barawe to Buulo-Mareer, were detonated. The AMISOM lead vehicle was damaged. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12:00EAT, IVO Buulo Mareer, Lower Shabelle: an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy was hit by two roadside improvised explosive devices (IEDs). The AMISOM forces opened fire indiscriminately after the blasts. Resulting causality figures not known. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: An al Shabaab landmine targeted Burundi forces in Burane. Al Shabaab reports six dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 12 May, c. 1200 hrs. BEERHANO: An IED detonated when an ENDF convoy passed a location at the outskirts of Beer Xaano (c. 28 km South of Beletweyne). An old man and a boy were killed after ENDF forces opened fire in retaliation. An ENDF soldier was killed and another was injured. Al Shabaab responsible for the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Twelve people have been wounded after African Union forces fired artillery on residential areas in southern Somalia town Leego. The intended target was al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: A BNDF convoy is struck by an al Shabaab IED in Mahadaay. One truck was badly damaged. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 27 May, evening, Muuri, Lower Shabelle: AMISOM forces were accused of firing mortars against civilian areas Muuri, and of a wider involvement in local clan conflicts. The targets of the mortars are not known. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 29 May, c. 1230 hrs. An RCIED purportedly targeting an AMISOM convoy from Mogadishu to Shalamboot detonated at Buufow - Bacad area in Merka District. An AMISOM lorry was damaged by the blast. There were no reports of human casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM fired two rounds towards Mareer Dheer, landed in farmlands. No causality or damage. Intended target not known.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Joint SNAF - AMISOM convoy struck by IED, one SNAF vehicle damaged, injuries reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fired RPGs at AMISOM defensive base in Mahaday district. AMISOM troops responded with artillery fire. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An explosion attack targeted African forces travelling between Bulla Mareer district and Aqabtalaal area in Lower Shabelle region on the evening of 7 June. The bombing damaged the vehicle - causality figures not known. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM logistics convoy from Baraawe hit by an al Shabaab IED, 2 AMISOM wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 09 June, 16:00EAT, Lanta Buuro, Lower Shabelle: an AMISOM convoy was hit by two roadside improvised explosive devices (IEDs). Causalities not known. Perpetrator believed to be al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Two RCIEDs, targeting an AMISOM convoy from Shalamboot headed to Afgoye, detonated at Lanta-Buuro vicinity (c. 20 km South West of Afgoye district). An AMISOM lorry was slightly damaged by the blasts. An AMISOM soldier was injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Following victory at Bariire, an AMISOM convoy is struck by an IED while moving away from the city. Casualties reported, though specific numbers are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds against AMISOM forces at K50, KIA unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM forces fire mortar rounds against al Shabaab forces. The rounds may have hit civilian areas. Causalities reported, though specific numbers are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF fired several mortar rounds against sighted group of al Shabaab fighters, KIA unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired four 80mm mortar rounds at AMISOM Djiboutian contingent base in Jalalaqsi district (c. 154 km South of Beletweyne town). AMISOM forces responded with artilleries, towards the direction of the attack. One AMISOM soldier was injured in the attack. He was taken to Beletweyne for further medical treatment.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched two mortar rounds at AMISOM base at Stadium Mogadishu in Wardhigley district. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and further claimed to have killed two soldiers.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 14:45EAT, Mogadishu Military Academy: three mortar rounds were fired towards the African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) - Burundi base located in Mogadishu University. No causalities reported. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: AM, IVO Kismayo, Lower Jubba: a Kenya Defence Force (KDF) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Resulting causality figures not known. This attack may have occurred on 14/06.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired mortar shells into AMISOM base located in the vicinity of Biya-Cadde (c. 30 km East of Mahaday district). AMISOM troops responded with artillery fire. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Early AM, Biyo Cadde, Middle Shabelle: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards the Burundian base located near Biyo Cadde. No causalities were reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: An IED, suspected to be planted by al Shabaab elements targeting an AMISOM KDF contingent convoy, exploded at Abdi Birole (c. 45 km South West of Kismayo town). Two AMISOM soldiers sustained life threatening injures. The injured were taken to Kismayo and MEDEVAC to Mogadishu for further treatment.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: An IED exploded in Bulo Burte airport after al Shabaab fighters managed to plant the device at the airport parking area. One AMISOM soldier was killed. AMISOM suspended flights inbound to Bulo Burte district. AMISOM EOD team conducted a full search at the airstrip for other IED devices in the area.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Early AM, Buulo Burto, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds against the Djiboutian forward operating base (FOB) of Buulo Burto. No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired mortar rounds against an AMISOM base, AMISOM responded with mortars, 2 civilians WIA.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 11:00EAT, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards a Djiboutian military base near Beledweyne. Two civilians reported injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED exploded at Jalalaqsi town (c. 180 km South East of Beletweyne town). Two donkeys were killed. It was believed that al Shabaab fighters planted the IED to target AMSIOM forces.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds at AMISOM Djiboutian Contingent base in Bulo Burte district. AMISOM forces responded with several artillery rounds. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: AMISOM patrol convoy hit by IED outside of Baardheere, APC damaged, 2 serious wounded, 4 minor wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 30 June, early AM: IED explosion targeted an AMISOM convoy, Industrial Road, Daynile district. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. No human causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An al Shabaab IED struck an AMISOM convoy. One civilian injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 11:40EAT: IED targets AMISOM convoy, Ceelasha Biyaha. Perpetrators suspected be al Shabaab, outcome of the attack not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A suspected roadside IED struck an AMISOM convoy travelling between Mogadishu and Afgooye at Abiikarow. There was no immediate confirmation of the casualties as result of the land mine blast, but reports indicated that AU soldiers fired randomly at a nearby crowd, killing at least one pedestrian.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An al Shabaab IED targets a AMISOM convoy. One person was severely wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 11 July, 16:45EAT, Industrial Road, Mogadishu: an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED) near Mogadishu's former perfume factory. One injury reported. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired about eight mortar rounds at AMISOM base in Garbaharey town. AMISOM forces did not respond. The mortar rounds did not land in the AMISOM base but landed in the town. One civilian was injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Jubaland Security Force
NOTES: AM, Yoontoy, Lower Jubba: an IED targeted a convoy of allied security forces of AMISOM and Jubaland forces. There were rumours US forces were also present. Causality figures not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 18 July, evening, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards a Djiboutian military base. No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: AM, Buraane, Middle Shabelle: a Burundian National Defence Force (BNDF) convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). No casualties reported. Perpetrators not known.

NOTES: Early AM, Golosha Matrooba, Lower Jubba: Kenya Defence Force (KDF) fighter jets conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab positions in the Golosha Mountains. Reports indicate the jets missed their targets, hitting a nearby settlement. At least four civilian deaths.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fired at least 3x 82mm rounds towards BNDF base, missed target, no KIA.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: AMISOM convoy protecting logistics hit by IED while en route from Buur Hakaba to Baidoa. One civilian truck damaged, one civilian injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM foot patrol targeted by IED. No injuries. One triggerman arrested and handed over to SNPF Afgooye.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Afternoon, Buulo Burto airfield, Hiiraan: unverified reports suggested three Djiboutian explosive ordnance disposal (EOD) technicians were killed by the explosion of a roadside improvised explosive device (IED) they were attempting to defuse on Buulo Burto airfield. The device was believed to have been planted by al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: AM, Baardheere, Gedo: al Shabaab claimed to have conducted a mortar attack against an Ethiopian military base. The incident remains unconfirmed.

The convoy proceeded and no further casualty was reported from the incident.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 26 July, evening, IVO Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: unverified social media reporting suggested an African Union Mission to Somalia (AMISOM) convoy had been targeted by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED).

NOTES: Early AM, Lagta, Lower Jubba: KDF fighter jets attacked an al Shabaab camp at Lagta, near Kolbiyow. The resulting causality figures not known.

NOTES: AM, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards the Djiboutian forward operating base located near Jalalaqsi town. Causalities not known.

NOTES: A KDF convoy en route from Sariile to Kolbiyow hit by an al Shabaab IED. One vehicle destroyed, 2 KDF killed.

NOTES: Al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds towards a Djiboutian forward operating base. Several rounds landed inside the base. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 28th July, afternoon, IVO Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: a Djiboutian convoy was targeted by a roadside IED. The device detonated early and caused no causalities. The perpetrators were not listed by the source, though AMISOM have recently been fighting al Shabaab in the area.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy along Hawa tako neighbourhood of Afgoye district exploded. The explosion damaged one vehicle and destroyed several shops at the roadside. There were no reports of casualties.

NOTES: 01st August, afternoon, Cabdow Dibile, Lower Shabelle: an AMISOM vehicle was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). Four Ugandan soldiers were injured by the blast. Perpetrators not known.

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an unspecified number of mortar rounds against AMISOM position in Qoryole district. NOTES: IED targets AMISOM convoy travelling between Leego and Wanlaweyn. One vehicle damaged. Driver injured.

NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters launched an unspecified number of mortar rounds against AMISOM position in Qoryole district. The attack either occurred on 01/08 or 02/08.

NOTES: RCIED explosion misses ENDF convoy. No injuries or damages reported.

NOTES: An RCIED detonated against an ENDF convoy headed to Baidoa near Dhay-Dhayki (c. 50 km North West of Baidoa). An ENDF soldier was injured and a vehicle was damaged. The convoy proceeded to Baidoa. Perpetrators not known.

NOTES: ENDF convoy from Baidoa to Qansax Dheere targeted by IED 25km east of Qansax Dheere at Birigay. Device detonated prematurely, no casualties.

NOTES: 20th August, evening, IVO Balcad, Middle Shabelle: a Burundian convoy was hit by a roadside improvised explosive device (IED). The vehicle was damaged. The resulting causality figures not known, however Calamada on 21 August reported seven soldier deaths.

NOTES: AMISOM convoy struck by IED, one vehicle damaged, one injured.

NOTES: IED targets AMISOM convoy. No casualties reported.

NOTES: A roadside bomb targeted an AMISOM convoy at SOS intersection in Mogadishu. No reports of casualties. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

NOTES: An AMISOM convoy is hit by a roadside IED between Buulo Mareer and Qoryoley, Lower Shabelle region. Causalities not known. Perpetrator not known.

NOTES: An African Union AMISOM convey was hit by road side IED. One vehicle has been damaged,casualty's unknown. Perpetrators not known.

About four civilians sustained injuries and were referred to Daarul Shifa Hospital in Mogadishu for treatment. Attacking force not known - likely either US or Kenyan.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 20 Oct: Al Shabaab fired several mortar rounds against a Brundian military base at Arbacow, west of Mogadishu. No injuries reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: KDF planes conduct an airstrike against al Shabaab positions in Dhasheq Wammo. Targeting grazing area whose access was restricted to local communities by al Shabaab. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: IED detonates against UPDF convoy en route to MIA. 1 Civilian vehicle hit, 1 injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED planted along the road, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling at Maryan Gubay in Barawe district, exploded. One AMISOM vehicle was damaged by the explosion. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. Additional reports stated that another IED exploded at a convoy in the area which was not far from the site of the first explosion.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters were observed at Kalabayr junction (c. 22 km North of Beletweyne town) where they coerced the local power company, located on the eastern side of Beletweyne town, to switch off electricity to the town. The company switched off the electricity for 30 minutes. AMISOM Djiboutian contingent forces received the information and fired several rounds of artilleries to the area where al Shabaab movements was observed. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab conducted an IED attack against a Jubaland, AMISOM KDF contingent and international partners joint force convoy near Barka village (c. 40 km North West of Kismayo Town). A Toyota pickup was destroyed because of the blast. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A suspected al Shabaab suicide bomber rammed an AMISOM convoy with an explosive-laden vehicle outside of Mogadishu along the Mogadishu-Afgooye road at Garas Barey. One confirmed death. After the attack AMISOM forces conducted a security sweep and arrested 19 suspects.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An IED buried along the roadside was defused by AMISOM forces travelling on the road at Ceelwareegow (c. 13 km North East of Marka district). It was reported that another IED exploded at KM 67 area and killed one AMISOM soldier and seriously injured another. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A Vehicle Borne Improvised Explosive Device (VBIED) has hit an AMISOM convoy on the Afgooye road north of Afgooye ex control. The vehicle's operator crashed into the convoy. Apart from the driver, the number of causalities are not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: A roadside IED targeting an AMISOM convoy exploded near Gumarta village (c. 20 km North East of Barawe district). The explosion slightly damaged an AMISOM truck. There were no reports of human casualties. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling near Shanta Buundo, outside of Bullo Mareer town under Kurtunwarey district exploded. The explosion damaged a military truck carrying soldiers coming from Bullo - Mareer headed to Mogadishu. At least two AMISOM soldiers were killed and three others were injured. Al Shabaab elements claimed responsibility

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: AMISOM convoy from Afgooye to Buulo Mareer struck by an al Shabaab IED near Buulo Nagaad. Outcome not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 05th December, AM, Beletwayne, Hiiraan: Unconfirmed reports have stated that al Shabaab launched an attack (mortar fire) against the an Djibouti-AMISOM position in Beletweyne. The UN reports 'some' causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An AMISOM convoy is targeted by a roadside IED on 21 December in Warta Nabada. Causalities, perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fires heavy artillery at an ENDF base at Buraalayaasha in Hudur. No immediate causality details. This event may have occurred the following day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 28th December, AM, Buulo Barde, Hiiraan: A road side IED kills at least one AMISOM soldier. Al Shabaab claimed three dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab carried out a suicide bombing against AMISOM forces near the Ministry of Defence killing at least a dozen. Second and third sources claim the blast was from a roadside bomb, killing two.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 2 Jan, c. 0700 hrs. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy moving from Barawe to Bulla-Mareer, exploded near Marin-Gubay village in Barawe district. The AMISOM lead vehicle was damaged. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 2nd December, PM, Buulo Mareer, Baraawe, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that an African Mission in Somalia convoy has been hit by an IED strike. Perpetrators not named by source, though al Shabaab frequently operates in the region and often carries out similar attacks. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 05/01/18, Bulobarde: One Djibouti-AMISOM soldier killed, two wounded when trying to dismantle an IED. Perpetrators not provided by source.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 06th January, PM, Bulo Mareer, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that a road side Improvised Explosive Device has killed at least one AMISOM troop and wounded several others. Perpetrator identity not reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 12/01/18, Diif, Afmadow: Possible KDF airstrike carried out ivo Diif. Al Shabaab had gained control of the village the previous day. The outcome of the strike is not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling from Shalamboot to Bullo Mareer town, exploded at the outskirt of Bullo Mareer town. The AMISOM lead vehicle was damaged. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: Al Shabaab launches a number of mortar shells against a Kenyan base at Hosingow. Kenyan forces 'suffered casualties including deaths and injuries as well as loss of properties.'

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 23rd January, AM, IVO Shalaambood, Marka, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed local reporting has stated an African Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) convoy vehicle has been struck by an Improvised Explosive Device (IED). One death reported. Perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fighters fired at an AMISOM base located west of Buloburte district (c. 115 km south of Beletweyne) using PKMs. AMISOM responded with heavy weapon fire. There were no reports of casualties. The security situation was reported to be relatively calm after the incident.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: An RCIED, targeting a UPDF convoy moving from Ceel-Jaale to MIA, exploded at Buulo Nagaad vicinity in Merka district. The explosion occurred at the fuel tank of a vehicle severely damaging it and killing the driver. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: An al Shabaab landmine targeted and hit an Ethiopian convoy outside of Baidoa. Casualities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 24/01, AM, Berdale: IED strike against ENDF. Result of the strike not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Reports coming in from Awdiinle area, which is located about 30 kilometres from Baidoa town, say that a pickup truck in a convoy belonging to the Ethiopian troops was destroyed when it hit a landmine. The convoy was travelling from Awdiinle to Bardale District. A reporter in Bay Region has confirmed that the vehicle was completely destroyed and an unknown number of Ethiopian soldiers aboard were either killed or injured. A similar attack took place in the area the previous day.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: Southwest forces travelling along MSR notice IED. Device explodes while ENDF EOD attempts to defuse. One ENDF injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 29th January, AM, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: A roadside IED strike has been reported on an AMISOM convoy vehicle. The explosion has inflicted casualties on the AU forces after one of their vehicles has been damaged by the IED, but the exact number of the casualty figures was not confirmed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: IED targets KDF foot patrol. Casualties reported, figures unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: Local unconfirmed reports have claimed that al Shabaab launched a mortar attack at an AMISOM position at Laantabuur. Outcome not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: RCIED strikes BNDF convoy. One Caspir seriously damaged, three injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: Al Shabaab fire several mortar rounds against UPDF base in Danow. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: IED targets UPDF convoy near Buulo Nigiriish, outside of Marka. One vehicle slightly damaged, no casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy moving from Balcad district heading to Jowhar, exploded near Ceelka-Geelow neighbourhood in Balcad district. The AMISOM lead vehicle was damaged. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. There were no reports of human casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12/02, AM, Gololey, Balcad: IED strike on AMISOM convoy. A second IED attack against a civilian vehicle occurred about the same time. Outcome not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: AMISOM fires artillery shells towards al Shabaab positions. Unverified report suggests seven civilians killed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: IED targets AMISOM convoy ferrying supplies from Afgooye to Balidogle. One truck with container hit. No casualties, damages TBC.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 21st February, AM, Bagdaad, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that and AMISOM convoy vehicle has been hit by a roadside IED. Outcome not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 21st February, AM, IVO Wanlaweyne, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that an AMISOM convoy vehicle has been hit by a roadside IED. Eight deaths reported. The attack may have occurred on 20/02, per a secondary report.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 04 March. Al Shabaab IEDs targeting an AMISOM ENDF convoy exploded near Awdiinle village. Causalities reported, numbers not known. Calamada (al Shabaab media) reports 30 ENDF dead.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 07 March. A road side IED disables an AMISOM vehicle. No causalities reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 07 March. c. 1410 hrs. Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM convoy passing at Ceel Waregow village. Causalities not known. Following the ambush, the AMISOM convoy hit an IED in the area. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the second attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 10 March. Al Shabaab fired several heavy artillery shells at ENDF positions in Baardheere, ENDF responded in kind. No reports of causalities.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 11 March. An IED strike destroying an AMISOM vehicle between Baidoa and Burhakaba results in one AMISOM soldier dead and one wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 12 March. An RCIED targeted an AMISOM-ENDF convoy in Aawdiinle. The blast struck the truck, though only caused minor damage.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 15 March. An IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy exploded near Arbacow settlement. One AMISOM truck was damaged and two AMISOM soldiers were injured. Perpetrators not named by the source.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 15 March. An IED strike followed by an Ambush on an AMISOM convoy has resulted in one vehicle being immobilised and several Ugandan AMISOM soldiers wounded.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 17 March. Al Shabaab launched an attack on a KDF position with heavy mortars. Casualty figures are unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 18 March. An al Shabaab roadside IED detonates against an ENDF convoy killing five soldiers. Al Shabaab claims 10 dead. The convoy was travelling outside of Luuq.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 20 March. SNA/AMISOM patrol hit by IED in Yoontoy Yarey. Casualties not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 01 April. An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy at Tabeekaha. An AMISOM truck was destroyed. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 01 April. Al Shabaab fire mortar rounds towards Shalambood. No casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 01 April. An al Shabaab IED targets UPDF convoy. One truck destroyed. Casualty figures unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 02 April. An al Shabaab IED targets AMISOM logistics convoy at Warmahan. One vehicle possibly destroyed. Causalities not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 02 April. An al Shabaab IED targets a BNDF convoy travelling from Mahaday to Jowhar. One water truck damaged, one injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 05 April. Two roadside IEDs have immobilised two KDF vehicles near Dhobley. Causality figures, perpetrators not known.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 24 April. Al Shabaab fighter hurls hand grenade towards AMISOM position in Shibis. Al Shabaab claims two injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 25 April. An RCIED, planted on the road between Bulo-gudud and Wirkoy villages and targeting AMISOM and SNA forces on foot patrol (the force may have been led by the Americans), exploded near Wirkoy village, 38 km north of Kismayo town. The joint forces were conducting a security operation against al Shabaab fighters when the attack occurred. Three SNA soldiers were injured and transported to Kismayo for medical treatment. Perpetrators likely al Shabaab.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 27 April. An IED, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling along the Afgooye-Mogadishu road, exploded at the vicinity of Boodboodka (c. 02 km south east of Afgoye District). The convoy was headed to Baraawe from Mogadishu. An AMISOM armoured vehicle was extensively damaged by the blast. Casualties from the incident was unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 27 April. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy travelling from Afgoye to Shalamboot town, exploded at the outskirt of KM 60 village (Siinka Dheer). The AMISOM lead battlewagon was damaged. Casualties could not be confirmed at the time of reporting. The perpetrators managed to escape and al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 06 May. Eight Kenyan soldiers were killed and two others seriously injured after an improvised explosive device (IED) hit a military vehicle near the Somali town of Dhobley on Sunday. Al Shabaab claims 15 dead.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 23 May. Unknown warplanes (likely either US or Kenya) conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab location at Shimbirole -Gudududow grazing areas (c. 45 km south east of Dhobley town). Casualties from the attack could not be established at the time of reporting.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 23 May. AMISOM fired artillery rounds towards residential areas in Elasha settlement village (c. 20 km west of Mogadishu) in Afgoye district after their defensive base was hit by a mortar round. Residents at the village confirmed that the artillery rounds impacted the village from the AMISOM base near Hormuud building in Elasha settlement. There was no response fire from al Shabaab militants or reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 30 May. UPDF forces shell suspected al Shabaab positions in Labayaq from Golweyn. Two technicals and one VBIED allegedly destroyed.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 31 May. Al Shabaab fighters conduct a hit-and-run attack against a KDF military base in Abdalla Birole. Three mortar rounds fired.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 02 June. An al Shabaab IED detonates near Djiboutian convoy coming back from Buulo Burto airstrip. One vehicle hit, no casualties reported. A second IED detonated in the area, but caused no damage.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 02 June. An al Shabaab IED targets UPDF convoy between KM50 and KM67. Convoy had departed FOB Lanta Buur and was headed to Marian Gubaay. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 04 June. Al Shabaab fighters attack UPDF FOB in Qoryoley. Four mortar rounds land outside of the base. Assailants repelled, no casualties reported.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 06 June. ENDF forces based at Baardheere opened artillery fire against al Shabaab fighters that were observed at Jungal village area (c. 08 km west of Baardheere town). Additional reports suggested that al Shabaab fighters were planning to attack the ENDF base. There were no reports of casualties.

ACTOR1: Military Forces of the United States (2017-2021)
ASSOC_ACTOR_1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 08 June. One American special operations soldier is killed and four are wounded when they came under mortar fire from al Shabaab near Jamaame. The Americans were on patrol with a group of AMISOM-Kenya forces at the time of attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 10 June. Reports stated that two mortar rounds (fired from unknown directions) landed at the outside of Qoryoley town in Qoryoley District. Al Shabaab probable perpetrators. The residents confirmed that the mortar shells landed in an empty space and caused no damage/casualty. The intended targeted is believed to be AMISOM base near first Bridge at Qoryoley District.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 11 June. IED strikes a BNDF resupply convoy travelling between Gololey and Garsaal. One BNDF soldier was injured by the blast.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 22 June. UPDF forces fire several mortar rounds towards a group of al Shabaab fighters 3km north of FOB Embresso. Outcome and resulting casualty figures unknown.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 25 June. Reports indicated that an RCIED targeting an AMISOM Convoy travelling from Balcad to Jowhar town detonated on the outskirt of Gololey village, Balcad District. At least two AMISOM soldiers were killed while two others were injured. The explosion also damaged an AMISOM APC. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 29 June. UPDF logistics convoy travelling between Beled Amin and Buulo Mareer is hit by a roadside IED. One Caspir APC damaged and two UPDF injured.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
NOTES: 30 June. Three AMISOM-Uganda are dead following an al Shabaab IED blast in Golweyn.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 30 June. IED targets Djiboutian convoy in Jalalaqsi.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 01 July. An al Shabaab IED targets a ENDF convoy outside of Baidoa.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 03 July, on or before. An al Shabaab explosive targeted a AMISOM convoy travelling to Buufow from El Jalle. The vehicle was destroyed. Believed losses of lives - estimated at 10.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 04 July. An IED reportedly planted by al Shabaab went off in the proximity of AMISOM (Djiboutian National Defence Forces) checkpoint in Jalalaqsi town. Information indicates that AMISOM forces were not at the checkpoint during the explosion. No casualty reported from the incident.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 12 July. An RCIED exploded near the Livestock Market in Heliwa district. The RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy that was moving from Maslah to the stadium. The lead AMISOM vehicle in the convoy was damaged by the explosion. AMISOM soldiers shot towards several directions resulting in the death of three civilian bystanders and injuries to five others. Casualties from AMISOM could not be established at the time of reporting. The perpetrators managed to escape.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 20 July. An RCIED, targeting an AMISOM convoy from Afgoye, exploded at Lanta Buuro village vicinity. The AMISOM lead battlewagon was damaged. There were no reports of human casualties. The unidentified perpetrator managed to escape.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: On 30 July, Al Shabaab forces reportedly fired at least 6 mortar rounds at an AMISOM/SNA military base in Embareeso village located 5 km north of Barawe. A UN source claimed that at least 2 AMISOM soldiers were injured in the shelling. Al-Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and claimed to have killed 3 soldiers. Other local sources have reported only one fatality, claiming that the event took place at the Barawe airport shortly after a helicopter landed, specifying that the deceased was a Somali soldier. Fatalities coded as 1.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: On 1 August, two Djiboutian soldiers serving under the African Union mission in Somalia were reportedly killed by a roadside bomb set by Al-Shabaab militants in the town of Bulobarde, Hiiraan.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: On the 5th of August, Radio Dalsan reported that Al-Shabaab militants had shelled an AMISOM base in Bal'ad town, causing injuries. According to the source, the shelling hit the base located in Hawa-Tako neighbourhood of the town. AMISOM responded by firing back mortars. No casualties were reported.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: August 6, 2018: A landmine explosion targeting an Ethiopian military convoy as it left Baidoa town and headed toward Bardale reportedly killed and injured an unspecified number of soldiers. Al-Shabaab officials speaking to Radio Andalus confirmed the event. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 8 August 2018: Two remotely triggered IED bombs went off as a convoy of AMISOM troops was driving through Heliwa district, Mogadish. According to the source, the first IED went off, damaging the first vehicle in the convoy and then the second exploded when AMISOM troops stopped to assess the damage. No injuries or fatalities were reported in the blasts.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 8 August 2018: A Kenyan military plane reportedly conducted airstrikes in Gadon Dabo town of Balad Hawo district, in Gedo region. Local residents being quoted by a pro-Al-Shabaab source say that the airstrikes killed a local herdsman (civilian).

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 8 August 2018: Suspected Kenyan air-force planes launched airstrikes on known Al-Shabaab held territory near Tuulan-qurac town (location unknown, however the source has pointed that it is near El Wak town) in Gedo region. Confirmed report suggested there were casualties, however no exact numbers were reported and unclear if fatalities among them.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
NOTES: 10 August, 2018: According to pro-Al-Shabaab media, Ethiopian soldiers going to chew Qat were hit by an IED bomb set by Al-Shabaab militiamen, causing injuries or fatalities. Unknown fatalities coded as 10.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-)
NOTES: 11 August 2018: Three Ugandan soldiers and two Somali government soldiers were reportedly wounded by a landmine that hit their personnel carrier near Afgooye district, Lower Shabelle. Al Shabaab was allegedly responsible for the attack.

ACTOR1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
NOTES: 11 August 2018: At least 4 civilians were killed by a Kenyan warplane that launched missiles at Laan Quru village, located between El Waq and Beled Hawo in Gedo Regio (approx. coordinates used). According to the source, the killed included a mother and two children as well as an elderly person (the source did not specify who the 4th person was).

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
NOTES: 16 August 2018: Pro-Al-Shabaab media has reported an explosion targeting a convoy of AMISOM troops in Bulo Mareer, Lower Shabeele. According to the report, the AMISOM troops suffered losses that included 'injuries and death'. Unknown fatalities coded as 10

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
NOTES: 17 August 2018: A remotely detonated IED exploded at the Gololey village, Balcad district, as an AMISOM convoy was headed to Mogadishu from Jowhar town. The lead vehicle was allegedly damaged. Three Burundian soldiers were injured. Al-Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 24 August 2018: A roadside bomb explosion has killed a Djiboutian soldier and wounded two others in the town of Jalalaqsi. The source indicated that Al-Shabaab was responsible for the attack. Al-Shabaab later claimed to have killed 3 soldiers during the attack. Fatalities coded at the most conservative point.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 29 August 2018: Suspected Al-Shabaab militants set off an IED device targeting Burundi AMISOM troops as they passed through Sokolwa, Balcad district. One of the vehicle's screen's shattered, no other casualties reported.

ACTOR1: Al Shabaab
ACTOR2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
NOTES: 31 August 2018: Al Shabaab IED attack on AMISOM (Djiboutian) forces near Bulo Burto. Insurgents claimed to have killed 3 soldiers.

ACTOR1: Unidentified Armed Group (Somalia)

SOURCE: Centre for Civilians in Conflict; UNSC; AP
NOTES: In the course of fighting between SPLA and SPLA-IO forces near the UN base in Jubas Jebel area, the two parties fired indiscriminately. A large number of bullets, high-calibre weapons and shells struck the two POC sites in the UN base, leaving at least 50 civilians inside the POC sites killed between 10-12 July, including around 30 on the 10th, more than 160 injured, including UN staff, and causing significant property destruction, including to International Medical Corps maternity ward and to the tents of many NGOs operating in the base. In the course of the fighting, two Chinese peacekeepers were also killed and another six peacekeepers were injured by shelling while patrolling in the vicinity of the UN Jebel HQ on 10 July.

NOTES: On 1 April 2020, pro-Houthi forces reported an 'attack' of anti-Houthi National Resistance forces on the Kilu 16 UNMHA observation point in the east of Hodeidah Red Sea port city (Ad Durayhimi, Al Hudaydah) with no report of fatalities nor injuries. *Note that the event is coded in Kilu 13 instead of Kilu 16 because it is the nearest existing observation post, and that these unclear 'attacks' are coded as shelling to reflect similar events previously recorded.
